Title: Specialists in Data Analysis
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Specialists in Data Analysis (Cat. I, Cat. II, Cat. III)




NTU International is preparing a proposal for the project ‚ÄúCooperation Facility for the Philippines ‚Äì Procurement of Technical Assistance to the Delegation of the European Union to the Philippines.‚Äù




In this context, NTU International is establishing a pool of qualified Non-Key Experts (Senior and Junior) to be mobilised on a short-term, on-demand basis during project implementation (48 months, expected start June 2026). Mobilisation will be subject to specific Terms of Reference and approval by the EU Delegation to the Philippines.




Requirements:

Education: Degree in statistics, economics, data science, or related fields
General professional experience: Experience in analytical or research roles
Specific professional experience: Data analysis, visualisation, evidence-based policy support
Language: English is mandatory




If you are interested in this opportunity, please apply and upload your CV via LinkedIn or send to recruitment@ntu.eu. Please note that only selected candidates will be contacted due to the large amount of applicants

Title: Business Intelligence Specialist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Er du passioneret omkring at skabe v√¶rdi med data, og har du lyst til at bidrage til en transformation i vores BI-team? Vil du v√¶re med til at formulere og drive vores datawarehouse-strategi i f√¶llesskab med et st√¶rkt team og sikre, at vi kan tage databaserede beslutninger p√• tv√¶rs af organisationen?




Hej, jeg er leder for afdelingen for Data & Insights, og vi arbejder med data for at skabe indsigt og drive strategiske beslutninger p√• tv√¶rs af vores virksomhed. Vi er i en sp√¶ndende transformationsfase og s√∏ger en medarbejder, der sammen med resten af vores team vil tage ansvar for at definere og kommunikere tekniske krav for vores nye datawarehouse og sikre, at vi kan levere p√• vores globale strategi s√•vel som p√• de enkelte afdelingers behov.

Vi s√∏ger en ny kollega, der kan tage del i ejerskabet over vores datawarehouse-projekt og drive udviklingen af vores BI-strategi sammen med teamet. Du vil arbejde sammen med et team best√•ende af BI Specialists, BI Developers, Web Analytics Specialists, Insights Specialists og AI Specialists. M√•let er at skabe et team, der er fuldt fokuseret p√• at levere v√¶rdifuld indsigt og strategisk r√•dgivning ved hj√¶lp af data.




Opgaver og ansvarsomr√•der

Som Business Intelligence Specialist hos os vil du arbejde i sp√¶ndingsfeltet mellem data og forretning. Dine opgaver vil prim√¶rt v√¶re:

Definere og kommunikere tekniske krav til udvikling og vedligeholdelse af vores nye datawarehouse i Microsoft SQL Server, i samarbejde med teamet
Sikre dataeksponering til slutbrugere via QlikView og QlikSense
Forst√•else og implementering af global strategi samt afdelingsspecifikke strategier
Udarbejdelse af KPI-rapporter og dashboards til forskellige forretningsenheder
Bidrage til data governance og kvalitetssikring af vores data
Samarbejde med kolleger p√• tv√¶rs af afdelinger for at identificere og l√∏se datarelaterede udfordringer




Skal du v√¶re en del af teamet?

Vi s√∏ger en ny kollega med st√¶rk erfaring inden for Business Intelligence, som √∏nsker at v√¶re med til at drive vores datawarehouse-projekt og skabe v√¶rdi gennem data. Jobbet kr√¶ver gode kompetencer inden for SQL og data modellering samt en st√¶rk interesse for at forst√• og st√∏tte forretningsstrategier. Teknisk erfaring er et plus, men det vigtigste er evnen til at formulere og specificere tekniske krav for implementering af andre BI-specialister. Vores datawarehouse-udvikling er en teamopgave, og vi s√∏ger derfor en kollega, der trives med samarbejde og f√¶lles ansvar. Vi √∏nsker hele tiden at forbedre os og s√∏ger derfor ogs√• en kollega, som gerne vil udvikle sig og tage del i interne sparringssessioner.




Vi s√∏ger en BI Specialist med f√∏lgende egenskaber:

Erfaring med forskellige SQL-dialekter (MySQL, PostgreSQL, SQL Server, Snowflake SQL)
Kendskab til og erfaring med dbt er en fordel
Kendskab til QlikView og QlikSense er en fordel
St√¶rk forst√•else af dimensionel modellering
Erfaring med data warehouse-udvikling
Gode kommunikationsevner og interesse for at formidle analyser og indsigter
Evne til at arbejde i en organisation med et st√¶rkt kommercielt fokus
Interesse for at forst√• b√•de den overordnede strategi og de specifikke udfordringer i de forskellige afdelinger




Mig som leder

Jeg har en forventning om, at du vil g√∏re dit allerbedste ud fra din faglighed, og at du er bevidst om, at vi l√∏fter i flok. Jeg vil altid v√¶re tilg√¶ngelig som sparringspartner, men i dagligdagen er det dit ansvar at sikre, at dine kolleger f√•r maksimalt udbytte af de data og indsigter, du leverer. Jeg gl√¶der mig til at f√• en mere med p√• holdet. Vi holder samtaler l√∏bende, s√• send din ans√∏gning snarest muligt.




De bedste hilsner,

Henri Legentil-Borup,

Head of Data & Insights

Title: Reporting Analyst
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to make an impact by transforming data into actionable insights to support business decision-making and securing data accuracy? Would you enjoy strengthening our understanding of the exposures to help create the best insurance solutions and customer experiences? If so, you should consider joining the Underwriting Analytics team at BA Industrial.

For Business Area (BA) Industrial and our Underwriting Analytics team, we are looking for a Reporting Analyst to help us strengthen our data-driven and evidence-based approach to underwriting.

In our area, we work with some of the largest and most complex global clients in an ever-changing risk landscape, where emerging exposures and intricate risk profiles have a significant impact on how we underwrite and assess profitability. Analytical insight and high-quality reporting are key to supporting this work ‚Äî and this is where your contribution will make a real difference.

About The Role

This role offers a unique opportunity to work with a wide range of insurance solutions within BA Industrial.

You will work closely with the Heads of each Line of Business and fellow analysts to ensure data accuracy in our systems, supporting effective and informed decision-making. You will also collaborate across lines of business and business areas to deliver reports and ad-hoc analyses when our standard reporting tools are not sufficient.

Tasks and responsibilities would include some of the following:


Taking ownership of gathering, analyzing, and presenting data quality controls to ensure our data meets the highest standards ‚Äî and following up to make sure corrective actions are implemented.
Collaborating on the design of an effective data quality control framework together with other analysts, Line of Business Heads, and the BI & Reporting teams.
Providing stakeholders with reports and data extracts containing critical, accurate information not available through standard reporting systems.
Contributing to the ongoing development and improvement of the Underwriting Analytics team.



We offer

Here are some of the benefits of working at If:


An including work environment where everyone is welcome
Career and development opportunities in the biggest insurance company in the Nordics
Social activities, as well as highly skilled professional environment
Possibility of hybrid workplace
Health promoting workplace with e.g., wellness allowance and various sports activities
Great insurance benefits



About The Team

You will join an experienced and highly motivated team that supports all Lines of Business ‚Äî including Property, Casualty, Cargo, Employee Benefits, and Cyber. From day one, you will have the opportunity to take ownership of your own deliveries and will be the main point of responsibility for data quality and reporting within the team.

We encourage you to make full use of your skills and ideas, and we will provide coaching and support to help you grow and reach your potential.

Who are you?

You have a strong inner drive and a genuine interest in data, analysis and communicating your findings. A high sense of responsibility defines you and you can be trusted to deliver. You are a self-motivated person with a proactive attitude and enjoy working both independently and together in teams.

You also have


Strong interest in data quality, reporting, and analytics, ideally with some professional experience in insurance, finance, or analytics.
Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Insurance, Actuarial Science, Statistics, Data Science, Analytics, Economics, or a related field; or equivalent professional experience in insurance analytics.
Familiarity with insurance financials, pricing, and underwriting processes is a plus.
Proficient in SQL and Excel; experience with Python, R, or other analytics tools is advantageous.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with attention to detail and accuracy.
Ability to communicate complex information clearly and effectively to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Motivated, proactive, and open to learning new tools, methods, and technologies to improve reporting and data quality processes.



Working language is mainly English. Knowledge of any Nordic language is a strong merit.

Additional Facts And The Recruitment Process

Application deadline: Last day to apply is 9th of February 2026, while interviews will be held on an ongoing basis.
To apply for the position: Please attach your CV and answer the questions in the recruiting system.
Work location: Stockholm, Oslo, Copenhagen or Espoo.
Travelling: Some travelling in the Nordic countries will be required.
Start: As soon as possible/by agreement.

Background checks will be done in accordance with the law in the country of employment.

We look forward to your application!

About The Role

This role offers a unique opportunity to work with a wide range of insurance solutions within BA Industrial.

You will work closely with the Heads of each Line of Business and fellow analysts to ensure data accuracy in our systems, supporting effective and informed decision-making. You will also collaborate across lines of business and business areas to deliver reports and ad-hoc analyses when our standard reporting tools are not sufficient.

Tasks and responsibilities would include some of the following:

  • Taking ownership of gathering, analyzing, and presenting data quality controls to ensure our data meets the highest standards ‚Äî and following up to make sure corrective actions are implemented.
  • Collaborating on the design of an effective data quality control framework together with other analysts, Line of Business Heads, and the BI & Reporting teams.
  • Providing stakeholders with reports and data extracts containing critical, accurate information not available through standard reporting systems.
  • Contributing to the ongoing development and improvement of the Underwriting Analytics team.


We offer

Here are some of the benefits of working at If:

  • An including work environment where everyone is welcome
  • Career and development opportunities in the biggest insurance company in the Nordics
  • Social activities, as well as highly skilled professional environment
  • Possibility of hybrid workplace
  • Health promoting workplace with e.g., wellness allowance and various sports activities
  • Great insurance benefits


About The Team

You will join an experienced and highly motivated team that supports all Lines of Business ‚Äî including Property, Casualty, Cargo, Employee Benefits, and Cyber. From day one, you will have the opportunity to take ownership of your own deliveries and will be the main point of responsibility for data quality and reporting within the team.

We encourage you to make full use of your skills and ideas, and we will provide coaching and support to help you grow and reach your potential.

Who are you?

You have a strong inner drive and a genuine interest in data, analysis and communicating your findings. A high sense of responsibility defines you and you can be trusted to deliver. You are a self-motivated person with a proactive attitude and enjoy working both independently and together in teams.

You also have

  • Strong interest in data quality, reporting, and analytics, ideally with some professional experience in insurance, finance, or analytics.
  • Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Insurance, Actuarial Science, Statistics, Data Science, Analytics, Economics, or a related field; or equivalent professional experience in insurance analytics.
  • Familiarity with insurance financials, pricing, and underwriting processes is a plus.
  • Proficient in SQL and Excel; experience with Python, R, or other analytics tools is advantageous.
  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with attention to detail and accuracy.
  • Ability to communicate complex information clearly and effectively to both technical and non-technical audiences.
  • Motivated, proactive, and open to learning new tools, methods, and technologies to improve reporting and data quality processes.


Working language is mainly English. Knowledge of any Nordic language is a strong merit.

Additional Facts And The Recruitment Process

Application deadline: Last day to apply is 9th of February 2026, while interviews will be held on an ongoing basis.
To apply for the position: Please attach your CV and answer the questions in the recruiting system.
Work location: Stockholm, Oslo, Copenhagen or Espoo.
Travelling: Some travelling in the Nordic countries will be required.
Start: As soon as possible/by agreement.

Background checks will be done in accordance with the law in the country of employment.

We look forward to your application!

Title: BI Data Specialist
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
About GoWish, √ònskeskyen ‚òÅÔ∏è

At GoWish, we‚Äôre building the world‚Äôs leading wish-list and social shopping platform ‚Äî a place where you can make a real impact and have fun doing it.

We‚Äôre on a mission to reinvent gifting for millions. We win together, driven by curiosity, ownership, and bold ideas that turn into real products. We experiment cross-functionally, push for excellence, and keep things playful as we grow ‚Äî together.

Team & Role Overview

As a BI Data Specialist, you will become part of our amazing Analytics team, and be a key driver of data-informed decision-making across GoWish.

You will act as an analytical partner to our business and product teams, proactively exploring data, answering complex questions, and helping stakeholders understand what is happening, why it is happening, and what to do next.

Your role will complement our existing Analytics Engineer & BI Specialist by leaning more heavily into exploratory analysis, product analytics, and business-facing insights, while still requiring experience with SQL, dbt, and analytical data modeling to ensure that insights are built on well-modelled, high-quality data, and that analytical logic is reusable, documented, and aligned with core business definitions.

Beyond delivering analysis, you will play an active role in driving data adoption across the organization. You will help teams build confidence in using data in their daily work - explaining insights, walking stakeholders through dashboards, challenging assumptions with evidence, and making complex analyses accessible and actionable.

Responsibilities


Act as a primary analytical partner for Product, Marketing, Finance, and other teams, translating business questions into structured analysis and clear insights
Perform exploratory and deep-dive analysis on user behaviour, product performance, experiments, and business KPIs using SQL, BI tools, and product analytics platforms such as Amplitude
Support product analytics and experimentation, including the design, execution, and interpretation of A/B tests
Help define, structure, and track core KPIs, ensuring consistent definitions across teams
Promote data literacy and adoption by sharing insights and helping stakeholders confidently use dashboards and analyses in everyday decision-making
Work hands-on with SQL and dbt to explore data, build or extend analytical models, and ensure insights are based on reliable, well-structured datasets
Contribute to data quality and trust across the analytics layer by identifying and resolving issues related to freshness, correctness, and logic
Build and maintain dashboards, reports, and documentation that enable self-service analytics and shared understanding
Improve analytical processes and best practices to help the team scale insights without adding complexity.


What We‚Äôre Looking For üåü

We imagine that you have:


3+ years of experience in BI, Data Analysis, Analytics Engineering, or similar roles
Strong SQL skills and confidence working directly with raw and transformed data
Proven experience delivering actionable analysis and insights, not just reports
Experience with product analytics, experimentation, or user behaviour analysis
Hands-on experience with dbt or analytics engineering concepts, such as data modeling, testing, and documentation
Experience working in modern analytical stacks (BigQuery and BI tools)
Strong communication skills, able to explain insights and trade-offs clearly to non-technical stakeholders
Curious, structured, and proactive mindset, you ask why, not just what.


Nice To Have


Experience supporting A/B testing frameworks or experimentation platforms
Experience working closely with product teams in a data-informed product environment
Familiarity with data quality checks and analytical testing in dbt
Experience defining metrics used across multiple teams
Experience with product analytics tools such as Amplitude, including building and interpreting dashboards.


Why GoWish should sit at top of your career wish list üíô

At GoWish, we believe great work comes from people who feel energized, supported, and excited to show up every day. That‚Äôs why we‚Äôve built a workplace where celebration, growth, and genuine enjoyment are part of the journey ‚Äî not perks on the side.

Take your birthday off with Happy Birthday Leave, enjoy 30 days of vacation to fully recharge, and join a team that fills the year with events and playful happenings. We invest in your future with pension and insurance, fuel your days with a weekly lunch scheme, and keep you going with unlimited snacks and sodas ‚Äî because work should feel good.

At GoWish, you don‚Äôt just build great products. You build a great work life.

Practical information

We collaborate in a flexible hybrid setup, with most of our magic happening at our bright, modern office in √òsterbro ‚Äî perfectly placed between Nordhavn and √òsterport Station. We‚Äôre ready for you to join us as soon as you are.

üëâ Ready to help shape a platform that already empowers 17+ million users (and counting)? Join us at GoWish ‚Äî and let‚Äôs build the future of data-driven innovation together.
Show more

Title: Specialist, Data & Operations
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you passionate about data, systems, and creating the foundation for excellent business decisions? Do you thrive in a global environment where collaboration, accuracy, and continuous improvement are at the heart of everything you do? Then you may be our new Specialist, Data & Operations at Pandora.

The Role

As a Specialist in Data & Operations, you will play a pivotal role in ensuring operational excellence and data‚Äëdriven decision‚Äëmaking across Pandora‚Äôs Global Merchandising organization. You will be the go‚Äëto expert for product and location master data, ensuring accuracy, consistency, and governance across multiple systems‚Äîincluding SAP, AX, o9, and FlexPLM.

You will also design and maintain impactful reporting solutions‚Äîprimarily in Power BI‚Äîproviding insights that help shape planning, execution, and strategic initiatives across the value chain. Your work enables merchandising teams globally to make better, faster, and more informed decisions.

Key Responsibilities


Own and maintain master data for product and location across global systems.
Safeguard data accuracy, compliance, and alignment with global standards throughout the product lifecycle.
Prepare and validate data for major programs such as HERO, COMPASS, and PLM upgrades.
Monitor data quality, troubleshoot issues, and support continuous improvement.
Build, enhance, and maintain Power BI dashboards and reporting tools for merchandising stakeholders.
Translate business needs into data and reporting requirements.
Collaborate with teams across Supply Chain, Retail, Product, Master Data, D&A, and Global Clusters to ensure smooth, compliant data flows.



What You Bring


3‚Äì5 years of experience in analytics, master data management, business analysis, or product‚Äërelated roles.
Solid understanding of ERP (SAP), PLM systems, and planning tools.
Strong analytical skills and commercial understanding.
High proficiency in Power BI (data modeling, DAX) and Excel.
A structured, detail‚Äëoriented working style‚Äîpaired with curiosity and adaptability.
Excellent stakeholder management and communication skills.
Experience working in global organizations with complex system landscapes.



Who You Are

You are detail‚Äëdriven, collaborative, and thrive in a fast‚Äëpaced environment. You enjoy solving problems, optimizing processes, and bringing clarity to complex datasets. You‚Äôre comfortable navigating across teams, influencing decisions, and driving alignment. Most importantly, you bring a curious mindset and a passion for creating value through data.

Why Pandora?

This is your opportunity to help shape the digital and operational backbone of an iconic global brand. You‚Äôll join a dynamic merchandising organization during an exciting period of transformation‚Äîcontributing directly to the systems, data, and insights that power Pandora's global product journey.

Additional Information


Global Career Band 5B



Did we get your attention?

If you see yourself in the position and would like to become a part of Pandora‚Äôs future, please do not hesitate to apply. We look forward to hearing from you!

We process applications on a continuous basis, which is why we encourage you to send your application as soon as possible.

You can also read more about Pandora on our corporate site‚ÄØwww.pandoragroup.com.

Icing on the cake

You will be working out of our beautiful Head Office in Copenhagen V, established in 2016 and designed to unite and inspire our teams. Besides our beautiful interior design we are also proud of our LEED Gold Certification for Energy and Environmental Design. This means that we use as few natural resources as possible and that we use them with respect. The result is a professional and dynamic space that is unique, comfortable and inspirational ‚Äì and delivers a true Pandora experience to anyone who works here or comes to visit.

About Pandora

Pandora is the world's largest jewellery brand, specialising in the design, crafting and marketing of accessible luxury jewellery made from high-quality materials. Each piece is created to inspire self-expression, allowing people to share their stories and passions through meaningful jewellery. Pandora jewellery is sold in more than 100 countries through 6,800 points of sale, including more than 2,700 concept stores.

Headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, Pandora employs 37,000 people worldwide and crafts its jewellery using only recycled silver and gold. Pandora is committed to leadership in sustainability and has set out to halve greenhouse gas emissions across its value chain by 2030. Pandora is listed on the Nasdaq Copenhagen stock exchange and generated revenue of DKK 31.7 billion (EUR 4.2 billion) in 2024.

Recognised by the Financial Times as one of Europe‚Äôs Best Workplaces and ranked #1 among Danish companies, Pandora is committed to building an inclusive and diverse workplace. We believe that reflecting the diversity of society in how we engage with our customers is essential to fulfilling our purpose: to give a voice to people‚Äôs loves. We are dedicated to nurturing a culture where everyone feels respected, valued, and empowered to thrive.
Show more

Title: Sr Customer Data Analyst | Remote | Europe
Place: Denmark
Description:
The AI orchestration of your wildest imagination.

n8n is the open workflow orchestration platform built for the new era of AI. We give technical teams the freedom of code with the speed of no-code, so they can automate faster, smarter, and without limits. Backed by a fiercely inventive community and 500+ builder-approved integrations, we‚Äôre changing the way people bring systems together and scale ideas for impact.

Since our founding in 2019, we‚Äôve grown into a diverse team of over 160 - working across Europe and the US, connected by a shared builder spirit and with our centre of gravity in Berlin. Along the way, we‚Äôve:


Cultivated a community of more than 650,000 active developers and builders
Earned 145k+ GitHub stars, making us one of the world‚Äôs Top 40 most popular projects
Been ranked as one of Europe‚Äôs most promising privately held SaaS startups (4th in Sifted‚Äôs 2025 B2B SaaS Rising 100)
Raised $240m to date, from Sequoia‚Äôs first German seed to our recent $180m Series C - bringing us to a $2.5bn valuation
And are grateful for our 94 eNPS score (most companies would call 70 excellent)


That‚Äôs the company we‚Äôve built. Now we‚Äôd love to see what you can build. If you‚Äôre applying, try n8n out - whether you‚Äôre technical or not - and share a screenshot of your first workflow with us. The easiest place to start is here: app.n8n.cloud/register.

We‚Äôre in a defining moment of an incredible journey. Come and build with us.

üéØ Your main goal will be to develop reliable, comprehensive tracking and analysis of customer usage metrics across self-service and sales-enabled accounts, with a strong focus on understanding and optimizing n8n‚Äôs product-led growth (PLG) motions. Your work will empower n8n to anticipate churn, identify expansion opportunities, and refine its pricing and GTM strategies.

To do so, you'll become the go-to expert on n8n‚Äôs complex datasets and work cross-functionally to deliver insights that directly shape adoption, retention, and revenue growth.

BUILD RELIABLE USAGE TRACKING FOUNDATIONS


Design and maintain robust, trusted datasets for usage, billing, and customer health.
Partner with Analytics Engineering to ensure scalable, automated data pipelines.
Drive data governance and integrity initiatives to increase confidence in business metrics.


TURN DATA INTO ACTIONABLE INSIGHTS


Develop a customer health score framework to anticipate churn and highlight expansion potential.
Analyze adoption, engagement, and revenue patterns to guide Product, GTM, and Finance strategies.
Recommend data-backed improvements that enhance monetization and customer success outcomes.


ENABLE TEAMS THROUGH DASHBOARDS AND FRAMEWORKS


Build intuitive dashboards and tools that make complex insights easy to act on.
Standardize metrics definitions and best practices across teams.
Create analytics frameworks that scale with our rapid growth and usage-based model.


Requirements

Must-haves


Experience analyzing product usage and customer behavior in a product-led growth (PLG) or self-serve SaaS environment.
üìä SaaS data expertise: You have 5+ years of experience in customer or product analytics within B2B SaaS.
üß© Usage-based metrics mastery: You‚Äôre fluent in ARR, MRR, churn, expansion, and usage tracking.
üíª Data excellence: You‚Äôre highly skilled in SQL and data manipulation, with strong command of visualization tools.
üöÄ Strategic insight: You‚Äôve turned complex datasets into actionable recommendations that drive business growth.
üß† Predictive modeling: You‚Äôve worked with scoring algorithms or churn forecasting to anticipate customer behavior.
üîç Technical fluency: You understand modern data warehouses and ETL pipelines.
ü§ù Business acumen: You grasp the nuances of both self-service and sales-enabled SaaS models.
üìà Experimentation mindset: You enjoy testing hypotheses and measuring the impact of your analyses.
üß∞ Advanced analytics tools: Experience with dbt, Looker, or similar analytics stacks.


Nice-to-haves


üåç Global SaaS context: Exposure to companies operating at scale across regions or pricing models.
ü§ì Statistical background: Knowledge of statistical modeling or machine learning for predictive use cases.


Why join us?

At n8n, your insights will directly influence how we scale revenue, optimize pricing, and build trust in our data foundations, all while shaping the future of automation. You‚Äôll collaborate with passionate teams across Product, GTM, and Finance, in a company that values autonomy, experimentation, and impact over process.

You‚Äôll join a fast-growing, remote-first environment where analytics is a strategic function, not a back-office task. This is your chance to define frameworks, own high-visibility projects, and grow with a company operating at the forefront of AI-powered orchestration.

Sound like a challenge you‚Äôre ready to take on?

Apply now and help us turn data into one of n8n‚Äôs strongest growth engines.

n8n is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

We can sponsor visas to Germany; for any other country, you need to have existing right to work.

Our company language is English.

You care about diversity and inclusion? We do too! Check out our Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging initiatives at n8n (https://www.notion.so/n8n/Diversity-inclusion-and-belonging-n8n-c1bec2fff536422d868b1a438d990e35).

Location disclaimer: If you see multiple job postings for the same role, it is most likely because we're hiring remotely for this role and posting in different locations to make sure every potential candidate can see the role. Please apply to the location you're the most likely to work from in the future.

Benefits


Competitive compensation üí∏ ‚Äì We offer fair and attractive pay.
Ownership üí™ ‚Äì Our core value is to ‚Äúempower others,‚Äù and we mean it‚Äîyou‚Äôll get a slice of n8n with equity.
Work/life balance üèñÔ∏è ‚Äì We work hard but ensure you have time to recharge:
Europe: 30 days of vacation, plus public holidays wherever you are.
US: 15 vacation days, 8 sick days, plus public holidays wherever you are.
Health & wellness ü©∫ ‚Äì
Europe: We provide benefits according to local country norms.*
US: Multiple low-premium, low-deductible medical plans with coverage for individuals and families‚Äîplus a no-cost premium HDHP option with a pre-seeded HSA‚Äîalong with dental and vision coverage.
Future planning üí∞ ‚Äì
Europe: We provide pension contributions according to local country norms.*
US: 401(k) retirement plan with a 4% employer match.
Financial security üõ°Ô∏è ‚Äì
Europe: We provide benefits according to local country norms.*
US: Company-paid short-term and long-term disability insurance, plus life insurance to support you and your loved ones.
Career growth üìà ‚Äì We hire rising stars who grow with us! You‚Äôll get ‚Ç¨1K (or equivalent) per year to spend on courses, books, events, or coaching to level up your skills.
A passionate team ü§© ‚Äì We love our product, and we prove it with regular hackathons where we see who can build the coolest thing with it!
Remote-first üåè ‚Äì Our team works remotely across Europe, with regular off-sites for team bonding. Some roles, like sales in the US, are hybrid‚Äîplease check the job description.
Giving back ü§ù ‚Äì We're big fans of open source, and you'll get $100 per month to support projects you care about.
AI enablement ü§ñ ‚Äì We believe in working smarter‚Äîeveryone gets an unlimited AI budget to explore and use the best tools to boost productivity and creativity.
Transparency üôè ‚Äì We all know what everyone‚Äôs working on, how the company is doing‚Äîthe whole shebang.
An ambitious but kind culture üòç ‚Äì People love working here‚Äîour eNPS for 2024 is 94!
Country-specific details are provided in your contract.

That‚Äôs the company we‚Äôve built. Now we‚Äôd love to see what you can build. If you‚Äôre applying, try n8n out - whether you‚Äôre technical or not - and share a screenshot of your first workflow with us. The easiest place to start is here: app.n8n.cloud/register.

We‚Äôre in a defining moment of an incredible journey. Come and build with us.

üéØ Your main goal will be to develop reliable, comprehensive tracking and analysis of customer usage metrics across self-service and sales-enabled accounts, with a strong focus on understanding and optimizing n8n‚Äôs product-led growth (PLG) motions. Your work will empower n8n to anticipate churn, identify expansion opportunities, and refine its pricing and GTM strategies.

To do so, you'll become the go-to expert on n8n‚Äôs complex datasets and work cross-functionally to deliver insights that directly shape adoption, retention, and revenue growth.

BUILD RELIABLE USAGE TRACKING FOUNDATIONS

  • Design and maintain robust, trusted datasets for usage, billing, and customer health.
  • Partner with Analytics Engineering to ensure scalable, automated data pipelines.
  • Drive data governance and integrity initiatives to increase confidence in business metrics.

TURN DATA INTO ACTIONABLE INSIGHTS

  • Develop a customer health score framework to anticipate churn and highlight expansion potential.
  • Analyze adoption, engagement, and revenue patterns to guide Product, GTM, and Finance strategies.
  • Recommend data-backed improvements that enhance monetization and customer success outcomes.

ENABLE TEAMS THROUGH DASHBOARDS AND FRAMEWORKS

  • Build intuitive dashboards and tools that make complex insights easy to act on.
  • Standardize metrics definitions and best practices across teams.
  • Create analytics frameworks that scale with our rapid growth and usage-based model.

Requirements

Must-haves

  • Experience analyzing product usage and customer behavior in a product-led growth (PLG) or self-serve SaaS environment.
  • üìä SaaS data expertise: You have 5+ years of experience in customer or product analytics within B2B SaaS.
  • üß© Usage-based metrics mastery: You‚Äôre fluent in ARR, MRR, churn, expansion, and usage tracking.
  • üíª Data excellence: You‚Äôre highly skilled in SQL and data manipulation, with strong command of visualization tools.
  • üöÄ Strategic insight: You‚Äôve turned complex datasets into actionable recommendations that drive business growth.
  • üß† Predictive modeling: You‚Äôve worked with scoring algorithms or churn forecasting to anticipate customer behavior.
  • üîç Technical fluency: You understand modern data warehouses and ETL pipelines.
  • ü§ù Business acumen: You grasp the nuances of both self-service and sales-enabled SaaS models.
  • üìà Experimentation mindset: You enjoy testing hypotheses and measuring the impact of your analyses.
  • üß∞ Advanced analytics tools: Experience with dbt, Looker, or similar analytics stacks.

Nice-to-haves

  • üåç Global SaaS context: Exposure to companies operating at scale across regions or pricing models.
  • ü§ì Statistical background: Knowledge of statistical modeling or machine learning for predictive use cases.

Why join us?

At n8n, your insights will directly influence how we scale revenue, optimize pricing, and build trust in our data foundations, all while shaping the future of automation. You‚Äôll collaborate with passionate teams across Product, GTM, and Finance, in a company that values autonomy, experimentation, and impact over process.

You‚Äôll join a fast-growing, remote-first environment where analytics is a strategic function, not a back-office task. This is your chance to define frameworks, own high-visibility projects, and grow with a company operating at the forefront of AI-powered orchestration.

Sound like a challenge you‚Äôre ready to take on?

Apply now and help us turn data into one of n8n‚Äôs strongest growth engines.

n8n is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

We can sponsor visas to Germany; for any other country, you need to have existing right to work.

Our company language is English.

You care about diversity and inclusion? We do too! Check out our Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging initiatives at n8n (https://www.notion.so/n8n/Diversity-inclusion-and-belonging-n8n-c1bec2fff536422d868b1a438d990e35).

Location disclaimer: If you see multiple job postings for the same role, it is most likely because we're hiring remotely for this role and posting in different locations to make sure every potential candidate can see the role. Please apply to the location you're the most likely to work from in the future.

Benefits

  • Competitive compensation üí∏ ‚Äì We offer fair and attractive pay.
  • Ownership üí™ ‚Äì Our core value is to ‚Äúempower others,‚Äù and we mean it‚Äîyou‚Äôll get a slice of n8n with equity.
  • Work/life balance üèñÔ∏è ‚Äì We work hard but ensure you have time to recharge:
    • Europe: 30 days of vacation, plus public holidays wherever you are.
    • US: 15 vacation days, 8 sick days, plus public holidays wherever you are.
  • Health & wellness ü©∫ ‚Äì
    • Europe: We provide benefits according to local country norms.*
    • US: Multiple low-premium, low-deductible medical plans with coverage for individuals and families‚Äîplus a no-cost premium HDHP option with a pre-seeded HSA‚Äîalong with dental and vision coverage.
  • Future planning üí∞ ‚Äì
    • Europe: We provide pension contributions according to local country norms.*
    • US: 401(k) retirement plan with a 4% employer match.
  • Financial security üõ°Ô∏è ‚Äì
    • Europe: We provide benefits according to local country norms.*
    • US: Company-paid short-term and long-term disability insurance, plus life insurance to support you and your loved ones.
  • Career growth üìà ‚Äì We hire rising stars who grow with us! You‚Äôll get ‚Ç¨1K (or equivalent) per year to spend on courses, books, events, or coaching to level up your skills.
  • A passionate team ü§© ‚Äì We love our product, and we prove it with regular hackathons where we see who can build the coolest thing with it!
  • Remote-first üåè ‚Äì Our team works remotely across Europe, with regular off-sites for team bonding. Some roles, like sales in the US, are hybrid‚Äîplease check the job description.
  • Giving back ü§ù ‚Äì We're big fans of open source, and you'll get $100 per month to support projects you care about.
  • AI enablement ü§ñ ‚Äì We believe in working smarter‚Äîeveryone gets an unlimited AI budget to explore and use the best tools to boost productivity and creativity.
  • Transparency üôè ‚Äì We all know what everyone‚Äôs working on, how the company is doing‚Äîthe whole shebang.
  • An ambitious but kind culture üòç ‚Äì People love working here‚Äîour eNPS for 2024 is 94!

Title: Research, Data & Market Analysis Specialist (Cat. II)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
NTU International A/S is leading a consortium for the implementation of the EIB funded project called: EV Charging Infrastructure - Market Study (CNC) and is searching for experts to support the core team during the implementation of this project.




The overall objective of this assignment is to develop a comprehensive, sector-wide analysis of publicly accessible urban EV charging infrastructure across the EU, providing a consolidated understanding of the main characteristics and conditions that shape neighbourhood, destination and urban hub charging segments.




Duration: The intended start date is March 2026 and the services shall be provided for a period of 16 months from this date.




Key Expert: Research, Data & Market Analysis Specialist (Cat. II)




‚òùÔ∏è Qualifications and skills:

At least a Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Economics, Data Science, Engineering, Geography, Urban Planning, Environmental Sciences, or another field relevant to the Assignment. (Minimum requirement)
Working command of English language (CEFR C1). (Minimum requirement)




‚òùÔ∏è General professional experience:

At least 10 years of professional experience in research, data analysis, mobility studies, infrastructure market assessment. (Minimum requirement)




‚òùÔ∏è Specific professional experience:

At least 6 years of experience conducting analytical or research work related to transport, mobility, energy systems, or EV charging/alternative-fuel infrastructure. (Minimum requirement)
Demonstrated experience in comparative assessments, benchmarking studies, market analysis, policy review, or regulatory analysis for public authorities or infrastructure sectors, evidenced by at least 2 assignments. (Minimum requirement)
Specific experience in qualitative and quantitative research methods, including structured interviews, data collection, cross-jurisdictional comparison, and synthesis of findings into standardised outputs. (Minimum requirement)
Experience preparing case studies, analytical reports, or structured comparative frameworks for mobility, transport, energy or infrastructure topics. (Asset)
Experience engaging with stakeholders such as municipalities, operators, regulators, or technical agencies for the purposes of data collection, interviews, or validation. (Asset)




If you are interested in this opportunity, please apply and upload your CV via LinkedIn or sent to recruitment@ntu.eu. Due to the large number of applicants, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Title: Business/Data Analyst Praktikanter ‚Äì Dataanalyse, Forecasting eller Backend
Place: Aarhus, Central Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
Vi s√∏ger praktikanter ‚Äì Dataanalyse, Forecasting eller Backend

Business/Data Analyst Praktikanter ‚Äì Dataanalyse, Forecasting eller Backend

Om os

Du bliver en del af Business Insights, som er en enhed i afdelingen People & Analytics hos YouSee. Vi arbejder med dataanalyse, surveyindsigter og visualisering af KPI‚Äôer, der d√¶kker mange af Nuudays forretningsomr√•der. Vi underst√∏tter ledelsen og forretningen med databaserede beslutninger og har fokus p√• b√•de kvalitet og relevans i de indsigter, vi leverer.

Dine opgaver

Som praktikant vil du kunne arbejde med √©n eller flere af f√∏lgende opgaver ‚Äì afh√¶ngigt af din profil og interesser:


Analyse af kunde- og forretningsdata
Udvikling og vedligeholdelse af dashboards og rapporter

Forecasting og statistisk modellering

V√¶rkt√∏jer du f√•r mulighed for at arbejde med


SQL (inkl. T-SQL og stored procedures)
Python og AI (til dataanalyse, statistik, API-kald m.m.)
Power BI og DAX

Azure Data Factory, Databricks og relaterede cloud-l√∏sninger



Vi forestiller os, at du


Er i gang med en relevant videreg√•ende uddannelse (f.eks. datalogi, business analytics, IT & √∏konomi) og skal i praktik
Har lyst til at bruge og udvikle dine kompetencer inden for dataanalyse og visualisering

Title: Data Analyst - Assets
Place: Aalborg, North Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to help bring more renewable energy safely to market ‚Äì every hour, every day?




At Norlys Energy Trading, we optimize portfolios of wind and solar assets across Europe and work closely across the entire value chain - from forecasting to trading. Our teams combine data-driven solutions and domain expertise, building models and insights together with analysts, quants, and even a dedicated meteorologist to turn data into real market impact.







Your role

You‚Äôll be responsible for monitoring the actual production of our wind and solar assets against short-term forecasts, identifying deviations in real time and finding the reason behind the deviation. You‚Äôll analyze root causes, implement analytical models and collaborate with trading, dispatch, and asset management to close the gap between expected and actual production.




Key responsibilities

Monitor live production vs. forecast for wind and solar across sites and portfolios.
Identify and quantify deviations and perform root-cause analysis (SCADA signal quality, availability, curtailment, grid, icing, etc.).
Deliver actionable insights for trading and dispatch (adjusted expectations, alerts, cut-in/out, maintenance windows, etc.).
Improve data quality: validation, outlier detection, and governance of high-frequency time series.
Collaborate with quants and the meteorologist on model enhancement and nowcasting (feature engineering, ramp-rate analysis, ensemble blending, A/B testing).
Define and maintain KPIs, standards, and runbooks for asset performance.
Conduct ad hoc deep dives and post-mortems on major events (storms, inverter faults, downtime).




‚ÄúEvery percentage point we improve in forecast accuracy makes renewable energy more reliable - and that‚Äôs how we move the green transition from ambition to reality.‚Äù

- Anders Borup, Head of PtX Solutions




Your profile

3‚Äì6+ years of experience in energy markets, renewables, TSO/DSO, or similar analytical/forecasting roles.
Strong Python and SQL skills; experience with Looker, or Plotly is a plus.
Familiar with SCADA/telemetry, time series, and data pipelines (APIs, message queues, data lakes).
Solid understanding of short-term forecasting (NWP models, ensembles, nowcasting) and common error patterns in wind/solar predictions.
Clear communicator able to bridge analysis, trading, and management ‚Äì in English.
Thrives in a high-paced, collaborative environment where trading, analytics, and tech work side by side.




What we offer

A dynamic work environment in Aalborg‚Äôs growing energy-tech hub ‚Äì helping build the ‚ÄúSilicon Valley of energy trading‚Äù in the north.
Close collaboration with talented colleagues across trading, quants, software, and meteorology ‚Äì and the chance to see your analysis drive real decisions in the market.
Freedom to shape tools, processes, and models in a rapidly growing company driving the green transition.




Tech stack (examples)

Python, SQL, dbt/ETL, Timescale/Influx/BigQuery, Airflow, Git, Looker, Grafana, REST/GraphQL, event streams (Kafka / PubSub).




Submit your CV and application through our careers page. Even if you don‚Äôt tick every box, we‚Äôd still love to hear from you.

Title: Revenue Operations Analyst (Remote from Denmark)
Place: Denmark
Description:
This position is posted by Jobgether on behalf of a partner company. We are currently looking for a Revenue Operations Analyst in Denmark.

This role is a key analytical position supporting Sales, Marketing, and Revenue leadership by transforming complex datasets into actionable insights. You will own reporting, build dashboards, and analyze the full buyer journey to uncover trends, identify growth opportunities, and improve operational efficiency. The position requires collaboration with GTM and Finance teams to support forecasting, budgeting, and strategic decision-making. You will work with data across CRM, marketing, and analytics systems to ensure accuracy and reliability. This is an ideal opportunity for someone who thrives at the intersection of data, strategy, and execution in a fast-paced SaaS environment, delivering insights that directly influence growth and revenue outcomes.

Accountabilities


Develop, maintain, and automate dashboards and KPI reporting to provide reliable, self-serve insights for GTM teams.
Analyze sales, marketing, and operational data to identify trends, performance gaps, and opportunities across the buyer journey.
Perform CAC and ROAS analysis for acquisition channels to optimize spend efficiency and growth strategies.
Partner with Finance and Revenue teams to support forecasting, budgeting, and planning through data modeling and historical trend analysis.
Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and governance across CRM, marketing, and analytics platforms.
Design and maintain win/loss analysis frameworks to capture feedback and inform improvements across Sales, Marketing, and Product.
Translate complex analysis into clear, actionable insights for technical and non-technical stakeholders.


Requirements


3-5 years of experience in an analytical role within a SaaS or high-growth tech company, or transferable experience from Consulting, Strategic Finance, Investment Banking, or Corporate Strategy.
Proficiency in SQL and solid understanding of data modeling concepts.
Experience building dashboards and visualizations in tools such as Sigma, Looker, Tableau, or Excel.
Familiarity with CRM systems and core GTM/revenue operations workflows.
Strong analytical instincts and ability to work with large, complex datasets.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to translate analysis into compelling insights.
Detail-oriented problem solver with high standards for accuracy and data quality.
Thrives in a fast-paced, evolving environment with a strong sense of ownership and accountability.
Comfortable working fully remotely using tools like Slack, Google Workspace, and Zoom.


Benefits


Competitive salary range: $115,000 ‚Äì $190,000 USD, based on experience and location.
Fully remote work with flexible schedule.
Health, dental, and vision benefits.
Opportunity to work on high-impact projects in a fast-growing SaaS company.
Collaborative, inclusive, and supportive company culture.
Career growth opportunities with exposure to cross-functional teams and strategic decision-making.


Why Apply Through Jobgether?

We use an AI-powered matching process to ensure your application is reviewed quickly, objectively, and fairly against the role's core requirements. Our system identifies the top-fitting candidates, and this shortlist is then shared directly with the hiring company. The final decision and next steps (interviews, assessments) are managed by their internal team.

We appreciate your interest and wish you the best!

Why Apply Through Jobgether?

Data Privacy Notice: By submitting your application, you acknowledge that Jobgether will process your personal data to evaluate your candidacy and share relevant information with the hiring employer. This processing is based on legitimate interest and pre-contractual measures under applicable data protection laws (including GDPR). You may exercise your rights (access, rectification, erasure, objection) at any time.

We may use artificial intelligence (AI) tools to support parts of the hiring process, such as reviewing applications, analyzing resumes, or assessing responses. These tools assist our recruitment team but do not replace human judgment. Final hiring decisions are ultimately made by humans. If you would like more information about how your data is processed, please contact us.

Title: Quantitative Analyst
Place: Aarhus, Central Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
Halia Energy builds proprietary trading systems for physical and financial electricity markets in the U.S. and Canada. We design, test, and operate strategies that compete in complex, data-rich environments, where timing, accuracy, and execution matter.




Our team combines deep market experience with technical skills in quantitative research, software engineering, and power system dynamics. We value open discussion, experimentation, and continuous improvement as we build systems and strategies that evolve with the markets we trade.




The role




As a Quantitative Analyst, you will build the models and datasets that drive our trading decisions. You will operate as both researcher and developer, owning the lifecycle from hypothesis to production code. You will turn research ideas into production-ready tools, deploying robust code that directly controls market risk.




Typical projects include




Engineering data pipelines to ingest, clean, and structure diverse market inputs for model training
Developing and backtesting models that predict short-term price formation and grid dynamics
Building the execution logic and risk monitors that control our live trading positions
Translating fundamental research into systematic, production-ready strategies




Your profile




PhD or MSc degree in engineering, physics, computer science, mathematics or economics
Advanced programming skills in Python and tangible experience with Machine Learning projects
Strong ability to source, clean, and structure complex datasets for analysis
Hands-on experience with cloud platforms and AI-assisted software development preferred
A scientific mindset: you are rigorous about model evaluation and honest about results




What we offer




Direct impact: your models directly influence trading positions and risk
We invest in the hardware and software that maximizes your productivity
A tight-knit team with extensive industry experience to learn from
Highly competitive salary and result-oriented rewards.
Pension, health insurance, and 30 days of vacation




How we work




We believe the best ideas come from close collaboration. At our office in Aarhus Sydhavn, you will learn directly from an experienced team and take part in the day-to-day design, testing, and refinement of our systems. While we offer flexibility in working hours and occasionally in location, we value being present together in the office.

Title: Digital Analytics & Insights Specialist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Turn customer insights into commercial impact ‚Äî and shape the future of digital retail with one of the biggest retailers in the Nordics

THE OPPORTUNITY

Join the strongest Commercial Business Team in the Nordic retail industry ‚Äî and help shape how we understand, engage, and convert customers in a fast-moving digital landscape.

We are looking for a strategic, data-driven talent to turn insights into actions and elevate our commercial performance. As our new Digital Analytics & Insights Specialist, you will play a key role in shaping the future of pre-purchase analytics, uncovering trends and patterns, and translating them into clear, actionable insights.

You will be the funnel and conversion optimisation owner and lead the development and improvement of the on-site customer experience. You will work closely with a highly skilled, ambitious and collaborative commercial team that thrives on impact and shared success. If you‚Äôre motivated by data, excited by measurable outcomes and eager to build strong cross-functional partnerships - then this opportunity is for you.

What You Will Do


Build & enhance analytics frameworks: Define and build KPI dashboards to analyse funnel performance and pre-purchase behaviour.
Turn insights into action: Translate findings into clear commercial recommendations, improve conversion rates, and drive revenue through A/B testing and tag management.
Collaborate with experts: Partner with the post-purchase analytics team to connect insights across the entire customer journey.
Shape how we work with data: Challenge existing processes, propose new strategies, and influence how the organisation achieves data-driven commercial excellence



YOUR PROFILE

You bring a strong commercial mindset ‚Äî you naturally translate insights into action and action into measurable business results. You are a curious, proactive, and confident communicator who thrives when collaborating across teams and influencing stakeholders.


2+ years of experience in e-commerce analytics with a deep interest in digital customer behaviour
Strong experience with GA4 and Google Tag Manager (GTM), especially in tracking, measurement and optimisation
A Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in a relevant field
Fluency in English and comfort working in an international environment
Bonus: experience with BigQuery, Looker Studio, or Qlik Sense



WHY JOIN US

Step into a role where your insights make a visible difference. You‚Äôll own key parts of the digital funnel, shape conversion strategy, and influence decisions across marketing, product, and the wider commercial team.

If you‚Äôre ready to innovate, challenge, and leave a lasting impact, you‚Äôll thrive here.

RECRUITMENT PROCESS

Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. The first step includes two assessments: PI Behavioural & Cognitive.

We look forward to hearing from you ‚Äî and welcoming a specialist ready to build, innovate, and elevate how we win customers through data.

We are one of the leading e-commerce players in the Nordics. We offer our customers fashion, kids, sports, beauty, and home on Boozt.com and Booztlet.com.

Title: Student Assistant for Data Analysis to support API Production
Place: Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Bagsv√¶rd, Denmark, Onsite

Data & Supply Chain, CMC Pilots

Are you starting your MSc in Engineering and looking to put your theoretical knowledge into practice? Do you want to explore how to combine process knowledge with data analysis to support decision-making in a real-world business setting? If so, we invite you to apply for a Student Assistant position within our Data & Supply Chain team at Novo Nordisk, where you'll collaborate with Pilot Plant scientists and technicians to create innovative PI Vision and PI AF solutions.

Apply today by submitting your CV including a short motivation for joining our team, a separate motivational cover letter is not required.

Your new role

As a Student Assistant in our team, you will play a pivotal role in supporting our Pilot Plants by providing them with essential access to data, visualizations, KPIs, and insights for data-driven decisions. Your responsibilities will include building displays and custom solutions that facilitate better business and process decisions. You will work closely with colleagues eager to learn from your contributions and share valuable insights with you. Your assignments will be influenced by your skillset and commitment to the role.

You may have the opportunity to support and explore areas such as:



Building PI Vision and PI AF solutions
Data visualization and reporting
Time-series data analysis
Bioprocess design and optimization
Enhancing pharmaceutical manufacturing processes




Student Assistant Position Details

A Student Assistant role at Novo Nordisk requires working between 8 ‚Äì 20 hours per week, with most hours on-site. We offer flexibility to accommodate your educational responsibilities, understanding the importance of your studies. A Danish work permit is necessary, and applicants must reside in the Greater Copenhagen Area at the time of application.

Your new department

The Data & Supply Chain team operates within CMC Pilots, where our mission is to deliver active pharmaceutical ingredients (API) for clinical trials. We aim to empower our Pilot Plant colleagues with access to data, visualizations, KPIs, and planning tools to facilitate informed decision-making in our processes.

Your Skills And Qualifications

To be considered for the Student Assistant position, you should:



Be studying towards a Master's degree in Pharmaceutical Drug Design, Chemical Engineering, Process Engineering, Chemistry, Biotechnology or a related field, with at least 24 months left of your studies
Have a foundational understanding of chemical processes and manufacturing
Have a strong willingness to learn and ability to manage your time effectively
Be eager to learn more about data analysis and tools, with previous experience in coding and data analysis being a plus.
Possess a valid work permit to work in Denmark and be available to work on-site.
Be fluent in English, with your CV submitted in English.
Reside in the Greater Copenhagen Area at the time of application.




Working at Novo Nordisk

Every day we seek the solutions that defeat serious chronic diseases. To do this, we approach our work with an unconventional spirit, a rare determination and a constant curiosity. For over 100 years, this unordinary mindset has seen us build a company unlike any other. One where a collective passion for our purpose, mutual respect and a willingness to go beyond what we know delivers extraordinary results.

Deadline

February 15th - 2026

We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants.

At Novo Nordisk, we're not chasing quick fixes ‚Äì we're creating lasting change for long-term health. For over 100 years, we've been driven by a single purpose: to defeat serious chronic diseases and help millions of people live healthier lives. This dedication fuels our constant curiosity and inspires us to push the boundaries of what's possible in healthcare. We embrace diverse perspectives, seek out bold ideas, and build partnerships rooted in shared purpose. Together, we're making healthcare more accessible, treating and preventing diseases, and pioneering solutions that create change spanning generations. When you join us, you become part of something bigger ‚Äì a legacy of impact that reaches far beyond today.

Coders Connect is thrilled to be partnering with a global leader in smart pest control solutions, helping expand their Innovation Centre just outside Copenhagen.

üìç Working Setup

Title: Clinical Data Analyst (Remote)
Place: Denmark
Description:
Role: Clinical Data Analyst (MD, DO, MBBS, or equivalent) - Remote




Locations: Denmark (100% Remote)




Compensation: Up to USD 120/hour




We are looking for a "Clinical Data Analyst" with clinical imaging experience contribute to advanced AI model training by creating diagnostic questions, reviewing AI outputs, and providing structured feedback. This flexible remote work enhances AI accuracy in medical imaging interpretation while fitting alongside clinical practice.




Key Responsibilities

Create and validate clinical radiology-based questions with structured reasoning
Evaluate AI-generated radiology reports for diagnostic accuracy and clinical logic
Provide detailed feedback to enhance AI model performance and reliability
Review and interpret diagnostic imaging (CT, MRI, X-ray, Ultrasound) cases for AI training




Essential Qualifications

Radiology experience and clinical experience
Current practising radiologists, fellows, or recent residents welcome
Strong clinical reasoning, attention to detail, and written English proficiency




Project Benefits

Fully remote with flexible scheduling (5-40 hrs/week)
High hourly compensation with weekly international payments
Exposure to cutting-edge AI medical imaging development
No clinical liability, patient interaction, or emergency coverage required




Equal Opportunity

All qualified applicants are welcome regardless of protected characteristics. Selection based solely on radiology expertise, clinical experience, and project requirements per applicable laws.




Apply Now!

Title: Operations Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Efter at have justeret profilen en smule, s√∏ger vi igen en Operations Data Analyst, der kan oms√¶tte data til indsigter, beslutninger og (endnu) bedre serviceoplevelser for vores +250.000 kunder. Du bliver en del af vores kundeserviceunivers - Planet WOW - hvor data spiller en v√¶sentlig rolle i, hvordan vi prioriterer, optimerer og udvikler vores m√•de at arbejde p√• som afdeling.




Du vil blive en vigtig sparringspartner for Planet WOWs management team, og du trives som bindeled mellem andre afdelinger, som bl.a. Business Intelligence og Salg. Du f√•r en central rolle i at udvikle m√•den hvorp√• vi arbejder med data - fra hvilke KPI‚Äôer og datakilder vi styrer efter, til hvordan vi visualiserer indsigter, og ikke mindst hvordan vi oms√¶tter data til konkrete, strategiske beslutninger og forbedringer.




Rollen er for dig, der motiveres af at arbejde i sp√¶ndingsfeltet mellem operationel performance, kundeservice og strategiske m√•l - hvor succes ikke handler om at levere rapporter, men om at oms√¶tte data til konkrete prioriteringer og initiativer.




DIN INDFLYDELSE

Som Operations Data Analyst bliver du strategisk sparringspartner for Planet WOW‚Äôs management team. Du f√•r ejerskab p√• centrale performanceindsigter og hj√¶lper os med at:




Forst√• hvorfor ting sker (ikke kun hvad der sker)
Prioritere de rigtige forbedringer
Oms√¶tte indsigter til konkrete beslutninger og adf√¶rd




Du er med til at sikre en f√¶lles forst√•else af KPI‚Äôer, datagrundlag og retning - ogs√• for kollegaer, der ikke arbejder med data til dagligt. Samtidig f√•r du ansvar for at drive tv√¶rg√•ende projekter - herunder i forbindelse med implementeringen af Salesforce som CRM-system i udvalgte teams p√• Planet WOW.




I samarbejde med Salg f√•r du en v√¶sentlig rolle i at sikre, at Salesforce underst√∏tter relevante arbejdsgange, processer og databehov p√• tv√¶rs af begge afdelinger. Dit fokus er at skabe sammenh√¶ng mellem kundeservice og Salg ved at sikre f√¶lles forst√•else af data, kundesegmentering og arbejdsgange i systemet.




Du bidrager med analyser af kundesegmenter og datagrundlag i Salesforce og er med til at sikre, at vi p√• Planet WOW har et solidt og anvendeligt beslutningsgrundlag for fremtidige arbejdsgange. Samtidig vil du have indflydelse p√• beslutningsprocessen om, hvordan Salesforce anvendes i praksis, s√• samarbejdet mellem afdelingerne bliver mere struktureret og underst√∏tter en sammenh√¶ngende kunderejse.




DINE PRIM√ÜRE ANSVARSOMR√ÖDER

Som faglig lead p√• Planet WOWs datadrevne rejse vil dine arbejdsopgaver variere, da du er med til at prioritere og s√¶tte retningen for rollen. Da stillingen er nyoprettet er ikke alt fastlagt p√• forh√•nd - tv√¶rtimod forventer vi, at du l√∏bende kommer med id√©er til, hvordan vi kan forbedre diverse processer og arbejde endnu smartere og struktureret med data.




I hverdagen kommer du blandt andet til at arbejde med f√∏lgende:

Title: Intern as a Consultant / Analyst - Aarhus
Place: Aarhus, Central Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
Are you aspiring to excel in consulting or analytics?

Join our team as an intern and embark on a journey to enhance your career in a dynamic environment.

About Us

We, the Managing Assortment Complexity (MAC) team operate under the Europe Zone Finance department, headquartered in Viby, Aarhus. We specialize in product and assortment portfolio optimisation, driving efficiency across markets and product categories. As an internal consultancy/task force, we facilitate diverse projects involving cross-functional teams and a high-level Steering Committee. Beyond projects, we have a quest to ‚Äúdemocratize‚Äù project and assortment initiative development and implementation. This, through a focus on spreading an optimisation mentality in the organization, as well as a focus on supporting skill development and analytical tools.

How You Will Make An Impact

As an intern in the team, you will engage in both strategic and operational facets of our agenda


In category reviews, extracting and transforming data into analyses and further into actionable business cases.
Participate in workshops and preparation of these.
Prepare materials and targets for Steering Committee meetings, reporting team and other decision meetings.
Maintain and develop Power-BI reports for global product assortment transparency, leveraging data from supply chain, commercial, and other sources.
Influence process development and optimization both in the team and with stakeholders.


What Will Make You Successful

We are looking for a colleague with an open mind who thinks critically and combines multiple angles of a problem into a solution. You should be a master's student enrolled at a university in Denmark. Furthermore, personality traits that define you are


Strong analytical skills and a knack for working with numbers.
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint, with a willingness to enhance your PowerBI skills and analytics as it will be an important task.
An outgoing personality and excellent communication skills.
Ability to multi-task - to juggle, plan and prioritise many simultaneous tasks.
Fluency in English is required.


What Do We Offer

As an intern in the MAC team, you will

Enhance your analytical and stakeholder management skills. Incl. PowerBi

Gain exposure to various departments (marketing, production, procurement, finance).

Develop decision-making skills in complex, ambiguous situations.

A wide variety of tasks and responsibilities, where no two days will be the same. You will naturally also have the possibility to influence and dive deeper into areas of your interest

You will be an essential member of our five-person team, interacting with stakeholders across many organisational functions, nationalities, and markets ‚Äì to make an impact on the business.

Would you like to join us

We look forward to receiving your application and will be reviewing applications on an ongoing basis, so if this sounds like the right opportunity, please send your application as soon as possible.

For additional information, do not hesitate to contact Nicolai Harbo at +45 29 91 53 51

Shape the Future of Dairy

Arla is a global leader in the dairy industry, committed to enabling good food choices that make life better, providing people with natural, sustainable nourishment, while taking care at every step to ensure Arla is a choice they can feel good about. If you are looking to shape the future with an ambitious global cooperative that truly cares about your growth, where everyone feels valued and empowered, and collaboration is the core of culture, Arla is a choice you can feel good about.

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
About Spaak

At Spaak, we partner with leading public affairs teams to keep them at the cutting edge of AI.

We started Spaak with the belief that AI would redefine how policy is developed and influenced. Our AI-native platform for public affairs professionals improves workflows across political monitoring, document drafting, deep research, and more.

We build, test, and iterate directly alongside practitioners to turn AI development into leverage for public affairs professionals. The goal is simple: better decisions, sooner, with less noise.

We help leading public affairs teams stay ahead in the AI era. Something you want to be part of?

Joining Spaak means being surrounded every day by experienced political consultants, exceptional software engineers, and startup operators. We truly believe we‚Äôre helping public affairs professionals enter a new era, and we‚Äôre deeply invested in making that change happen.

The Spaak team operates out of Copenhagen and Brussels, with more cities to come.

What you‚Äôll do:


Own the end-to-end architecture and implementation of our data platform, from ingestion and pipelines to modeling and serving
Design, build, and maintain reliable data that powers customer features
Lead PoCs for new data tools and solve complex, high-level technical challenges around scale, performance, and robustness


Tech stack: Typescript, Node.js, PostgreSQL, CDC, event-driven architecture, GCP, Kubernetes and much more

Who you are:


A targeted and ambitious data engineer with a few years of experience with architecting and building modern data platforms and pipelines
You have strong data and software engineering fundamentals
You‚Äôre ambitious and feel best at home in fast-paced & intense environments
You‚Äôre self-driven and take ownership of the data systems you engineer
You‚Äôre humble, collaborative, and focused on what‚Äôs best for the customers


What you‚Äôll get:


Truly meaningful and exciting work: You‚Äôll help our incredibly skilled customers move into a future AI-driven era
Incredibly skilled colleagues: We are gathering a team of A-players to be your colleagues
Front-row seat at a fast-growing company: You'll learn from being part of an exciting, but hard, journey of scaling a company in a complex space.
Competitive compensation: Competitive salary, benefits, and opportunities to grow.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Place: Taastrup, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Help shape the future of decision-making at the intersection of AI and neuroscience

At Neurons, we help brands understand how people actually perceive, feel, and decide; before anything goes live. By combining AI, computer vision, and neuroscience, we enable companies to predict attention, emotion, and impact at scale, removing guesswork from creative and marketing decisions.

We‚Äôre now looking for a Data Scientist who wants to work on meaningful problems, validate cutting-edge AI models, and directly influence how our technology is trusted and used by customers worldwide.

What You'll Achieve In This Role

You'll be expected to:


Establish and validate new statistical metrics that underpin how Neurons‚Äô AI models are evaluated, trusted, and evolved.
Raise the bar on model reliability and interpretability, ensuring our predictions are not just accurate, but consistent and explainable.
Partner closely with Product, Engineering, and AI teams to translate real-world customer and internal needs into rigorous analytical frameworks.
Turn complex statistical findings into clear insights, enabling both technical and non-technical stakeholders to make confident decisions.
Continuously evolve our validation methodologies, keeping Neurons at the forefront of statistical modelling in applied AI and neuroscience.


What You'll Be Responsible For


Acting as a senior statistical partner to the AI team, identifying and validating metrics for computer vision‚Äìbased models.
Designing and executing analytical experiments to evaluate model accuracy, robustness, and reliability.
Identifying relevant data sources and building data pipelines to support rigorous model validation.
Analyzing large, complex datasets to uncover patterns, trends, and inconsistencies in predictions.
Preparing clear reports, documentation, and presentations for a wide range of stakeholders; from engineers to commercial teams.
Staying up to date with modern statistical modelling techniques and validation frameworks, and bringing new ideas into production.


What You Bring

Experience & Skills


A Master‚Äôs degree (or equivalent) in Statistics, Applied Mathematics, or a related quantitative field.
3+ years of experience in applied statistical analysis, with strong foundations in:
Regression modelling
Hypothesis testing
Experimental design
Strong Python and SQL skills for data extraction, exploration, and analysis.
Experience building robust data workflows and analyzing complex relationships in data.
A sharp eye for detail and a genuine curiosity for data exploration.


How You Create Impact

You‚Äôre a collaborative team player who enjoys working across disciplines and contributing to a positive, inclusive team environment. You take initiative and ownership in your work, approaching challenges with a proactive, can-do attitude and the ability to move things forward without needing constant direction. You‚Äôre naturally curious and innovative, excited to explore new technologies and methods; particularly in the evolving space of AI and neuroscience. Just as importantly, you‚Äôre a clear and thoughtful communicator, able to translate complex statistical ideas into language that resonates with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

Why Join Neurons?


Be part of a leading company at the intersection of AI and neuroscience, working on technology that is changing how decisions are made.
Contribute to cutting-edge, data-heavy products used by global brands.
Work in a dynamic, collaborative environment where your ideas and expertise genuinely influence the product.
Join a culture that values curiosity, innovation, and personal growth, not just outputs.
Help shape the future of neuromarketing and consumer neuroscience, and how AI is validated and trusted in the real world.


Join the Neurons Movement!

In our inclusive culture, innovation flourishes. We believe true progress comes from being yourself, sharing ideas freely, and collaborating with inspiring colleagues. So if you're all about the above, come help us redefine consumer neuroscience!

Innovation at our Core: Our 11-year legacy began with neuroscientist and bestselling author, Dr. Thomas Zo√´ga Rams√∏y, a leading figure in the fields of applied neuroscience, consumer neuroscience, and neuromarketing. Innovation continues to drive everything we do, from our CEO to each and every team member, we push boundaries and foster forward-thinking, leveraging data and AI to transform our industry.

Team Spirit and Culture: We‚Äôre committed to fostering a culture that values teamwork and personal growth. Building something extraordinary requires effective collaboration and top talent. So why not surround yourself with a supportive team that drives success!

Results with Empathy: We‚Äôre focused on achieving results while also prioritizing empathy. Join a culture that balances ambition with consideration and where continuous feedback on performance and development is encouraged. Here, success is measured not just in numbers, but in relationships, collaboration, and positive impact.

Diverse and Inclusive: Our team of 85 talents from 30 nations proudly celebrates diversity. By embracing diversity and individual development, we believe that we can achieve sustainable growth and remain committed to fostering a culture where people of all backgrounds feel welcomed.

At Neurons, the journey is as exciting as the destination. Experience a career where innovation, teamwork, and meaningful results come together in ways you've never imagined!

We Offer An Array of Benefits

We‚Äôre all about keeping our people happy, healthy, and feeling their best. From wellness-focused perks to little moments of everyday care, we make sure you have plenty of ways to recharge and stay balanced.

And because we truly enjoy each other‚Äôs company, we love getting together for some end-of-week fun. Whether we're laughing, socializing, or just unwinding as a team, our Friday hangouts always bring good vibes and great company.

Other benefits include:


In-house lunch
Pension Plan
Private Health insurance
Parental leave benefits
Quarterly company events
Team Events
