Title: Student Assistant - Performance & Contracting
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

üí•üìäHelp shape the path for our team with Data, Performance & Project Management üí•üìä

We are looking for a Student Assistant to join our team ‚ÄòPerformance & Contracting - Logistics & Repair Operations‚Äô in Copenhagen, Denmark.

We are a team consisting of Data Analysts, Process & Performance Managers as well as Airbus Operating System Experts. You will truly be part of a global, multi-cultural and multi-disciplinary team with representation in Denmark, Germany, Singapore and soon in the US.

If you are someone who is ready to roll up your sleeves and help us by applying your knowledge on Data Analytics, Performance & Project Management then you might be the person we are looking for!.

Your Responsibilities


Data analysis enabling data driven decision making
Leading small initiatives and projects such as building a team site or monitoring and following up on project plans or even planning a workshop!
Following up on open actions from various performance management review meetings
Small adhoc support tasks - Helping a colleague who may need some assistance with creating presentation material


Travel days to be expected are approximately 5 days per year mainly to Hamburg, Germany.

How You Will Contribute To The Team

To be a good fit for this role, you should currently be enrolled in a University degree in Data Science, Data & Automation, IT or similar. Project Management experience will be an advantage. Ideally you have 1-2 years of experience in a similar role. What we value most is your can-do attitude, curiosity and willingness to learn and apply what you have learnt and have lots of fun along the way!.

Excellent command of both written and spoken English is essential.

What does your next challenge look like?

At SATAIR, we believe in sustainable aviation that allows people to travel and connect across the globe.

We are on a mission to provide world class material solutions that keep aircraft flying and extend their lifespan.

In Satair, you can challenge the status quo, pioneer new ways of working, and generate real value for airlines and suppliers worldwide.

Being part of the Airbus family gives us the opportunity to live a global mindset, working in international and diverse teams and collaborating across functions, sites and cultures.

If you want to work as one team embracing a can-do attitude in a demanding environment, then we offer a great place to explore, learn, and grow, making an impact on aviation‚Äôs digital and sustainable transformation.

If you want to know more about our business, have a closer look at our website www.SATAIR.com or check out our SATAIR Youtube Channel at www.youtube.com/sataircompany !

Come on board and join us at Satair, an Airbus Services Company!

About SATAIR

Satair is an Airbus Services company offering first-class material management solutions in the aviation aftermarket industry. We take pride in delivering an excellent customer experience around the clock, driving innovation, and contributing to aviation‚Äôs digital and sustainable transformation.

With our global functional organisation spanning 11 sites and locations worldwide, and a team of over 1,900 people supporting a $3.3 billion turnover, you will be part of a truly global company that continues to grow year after year.

Welcome to the Satair family!

If you want to know more about our business, have a closer look at our website www.SATAIR.com or check out our SATAIR Youtube Channel at www.youtube.com/sataircompany !

What do we offer at SATAIR?

At SATAIR, you will find much more than a job - we offer you the possibility of growing both your personal and professional capacities in a fun, supportive and informal working environment, where you will be encouraged to engage, share knowledge and ideas.

SATAIR is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We love to bring in people with different backgrounds and experiences as we believe it enhances our performance immensely!

Here is a selection of some of the benefits we offer our employees in Copenhagen:


Competitive remuneration, including short term incentive bonus on all levels
Work/life balance: hybrid working, flex time, maternity/paternity/parental leave, 29 days of holiday + senior and flex days
Personal development: personalized development plans, large portfolio of learning solutions and many internal mobility opportunities, both locally and globally
Health and well-being: Health insurance, in-house canteen with many healthy options


Come on board and join us at Satair, an Airbus Services Company

Please send us your application as soon as possible to get the opportunity to become part of an exceptional global team!

We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief.

When applying for the position, you accept our data privacy statement: http://www.SATAIR.com/privacy

This job requires an awareness of any potential compliance risks and a commitment to act with integrity, as the foundation for the Company‚Äôs success, reputation and sustainable growth.

Company

Satair A/S

Contract Type

Permanent

Experience Level

Student

Job Family

Support to Management

By submitting your CV or application you are consenting to Airbus using and storing information about you for monitoring purposes relating to your application or future employment. This information will only be used by Airbus.

Airbus is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief.

Airbus is, and always has been, committed to equal opportunities for all. As such, we will never ask for any type of monetary exchange in the frame of a recruitment process. Any impersonation of Airbus to do so should be reported to emsom@airbus.com.

At Airbus, we support you to work, connect and collaborate more easily and flexibly. Wherever possible, we foster flexible working arrangements to stimulate innovative thinking.

Satair is an Airbus Services company offering first-class material management solutions in the aviation aftermarket industry. We take pride in delivering an excellent customer experience around the clock, driving innovation, and contributing to aviation‚Äôs digital and sustainable transformation.

With our global functional organisation spanning 11 sites and locations worldwide, and a team of over 1,900 people supporting a $3.3 billion turnover, you will be part of a truly global company that continues to grow year after year.

Welcome to the Satair family!

If you want to know more about our business, have a closer look at our website www.SATAIR.com or check out our SATAIR Youtube Channel at www.youtube.com/sataircompany !

What do we offer at SATAIR?

At SATAIR, you will find much more than a job - we offer you the possibility of growing both your personal and professional capacities in a fun, supportive and informal working environment, where you will be encouraged to engage, share knowledge and ideas.

SATAIR is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We love to bring in people with different backgrounds and experiences as we believe it enhances our performance immensely!

Here is a selection of some of the benefits we offer our employees in Copenhagen:

  • Competitive remuneration, including short term incentive bonus on all levels
  • Work/life balance: hybrid working, flex time, maternity/paternity/parental leave, 29 days of holiday + senior and flex days
  • Personal development: personalized development plans, large portfolio of learning solutions and many internal mobility opportunities, both locally and globally
  • Health and well-being: Health insurance, in-house canteen with many healthy options

Come on board and join us at Satair, an Airbus Services Company

Please send us your application as soon as possible to get the opportunity to become part of an exceptional global team!

We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief.

When applying for the position, you accept our data privacy statement: http://www.SATAIR.com/privacy

This job requires an awareness of any potential compliance risks and a commitment to act with integrity, as the foundation for the Company‚Äôs success, reputation and sustainable growth.

Company

Satair A/S

Contract Type

Permanent

Experience Level

Student

Job Family

Support to Management

By submitting your CV or application you are consenting to Airbus using and storing information about you for monitoring purposes relating to your application or future employment. This information will only be used by Airbus.

Airbus is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief.

Airbus is, and always has been, committed to equal opportunities for all. As such, we will never ask for any type of monetary exchange in the frame of a recruitment process. Any impersonation of Airbus to do so should be reported to emsom@airbus.com.

At Airbus, we support you to work, connect and collaborate more easily and flexibly. Wherever possible, we foster flexible working arrangements to stimulate innovative thinking.

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
About GoWish, √ònskeskyen ‚òÅÔ∏è

At GoWish, we‚Äôre building the world‚Äôs leading wish-list and social shopping platform ‚Äî a place where you can make a real impact and have fun doing it.

We‚Äôre on a mission to reinvent gifting for millions. We win together, driven by curiosity, ownership, and bold ideas that turn into real products. We experiment cross-functionally, push for excellence, and keep things playful as we grow ‚Äî together.

Team & Role Overview

The Monetization team sits at the heart of GoWish‚Äôs business model. We build, own, and evolve the systems that translate user intent and product interaction into measurable, trustworthy value for our B2B partners. This includes advertiser-facing products, click tracking and attribution systems, and data platforms that power insights, optimization, and decision-making.

Our Work Directly Impacts


revenue generation
partner trust
strategic business decisions


The works closely with the commercial side of the business with a strong engineering mindset, actively experimenting with new monetization models, data products, and insights to unlock additional growth. We build long-lived systems where correctness, scalability, and thoughtful architecture are foundational - enabling the business to move fast without compromising trust or quality.

As a Data Engineer in the Monetization team, you will play a crucial role in building and evolving GoWish‚Äôs commercial insights platform, enabling software engineers, product teams, commercial stakeholders, and external partners to access trusted, low-latency performance data through internal systems and APIs.

This role sits at the intersection of analytics, operational systems, and APIs, where you will design and operate data pipelines and storage solutions that transform large-scale analytical data into production-grade, API-ready datasets - without compromising correctness, reliability, or governance.

This is not a dashboard-focused role. It is data engineering for production systems with real commercial impact.

Responsibilities


Design, build, and maintain near-real-time data pipelines based on BigQuery and streaming sources
Model and serve analytical datasets into an operational analytical database (OLAP) to support low-latency APIs
Own the end-to-end data flow behind DataHub APIs used by partners and internal teams
Work with raw event and tracking data to model, transform, and enrich datasets that enable reliable insights and decision-making
Take a leading role in data quality and observability, defining and measuring key quality metrics such as completeness, freshness, and consistency, and implementing governance and monitoring frameworks that surface issues early - before they affect downstream systems, partner trust, or decision-making
Implement schema governance, data quality checks, and observability for production data pipelines
Optimize pipelines and storage for performance, scalability, and cost
Collaborate closely with backend engineers to define data contracts, latency requirements, and access patterns.


What We‚Äôre Looking For üåü

We imagine that you have:


3‚Äì5+ years of experience in Data Engineering or Data Platform roles
Strong experience building and operating production-grade batch and streaming data pipelines (e.g. BigQuery, Dataflow)
Hands-on experience with cloud-native infrastructure and containerized workloads on GCP (Kubernetes, Docker, Terraform)
Strong SQL skills and experience working in modern analytical ecosystems (BigQuery, dbt, and BI tools)
Experience modelling data to derive insights from raw event data, not just moving data from A to B
Experience designing and orchestrating data models and pipelines that serve operational systems and APIs
A strong ownership mindset with a high bar for data correctness, reliability, and clarity
Clear communicator, able to explain complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.


Nice To Have


Experience with high-performance OLAP analytical databases
Experience designing or working with Data Clean Rooms
Streaming-first architectures and low-latency data processing
Experience defining and monitoring data quality metrics tied to business outcomes.


Why GoWish should sit at top of your career wish list üíô

At GoWish, we believe great work comes from people who feel energized, supported, and excited to show up every day. That‚Äôs why we‚Äôve built a workplace where celebration, growth, and genuine enjoyment are part of the journey ‚Äî not perks on the side.

Take your birthday off with Happy Birthday Leave, enjoy 30 days of vacation to fully recharge, and join a team that fills the year with events and playful happenings. We invest in your future with pension and insurance, fuel your days with a weekly lunch scheme, and keep you going with unlimited snacks and sodas ‚Äî because work should feel good.

At GoWish, you don‚Äôt just build great products. You build a great work life.

Practical information

We collaborate in a flexible hybrid setup, with most of our magic happening at our bright, modern office in √òsterbro ‚Äî perfectly placed between Nordhavn and √òsterport Station. We‚Äôre ready for you to join us as soon as you are.

üëâ Ready to help shape a platform that already empowers 17+ million users (and counting)? Join us at GoWish ‚Äî and let‚Äôs build the future of data-driven innovation together.

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Drive meaningful change¬†¬†

Are you ready to take your data engineering skills to the next level? This role gives you full ownership of designing, building and scaling data solutions involving pipelines and infrastructure in a modern, cloud-native environment. You‚Äôll work hands-on with cutting-edge technologies, influence platform decisions, and help shape how data drives impact across the company.¬†

This is a chance to build on our core platform, solve real data challenges, and leave your mark on a growing platform.¬†

¬†

Get a glimpse of our world¬†

We‚Äôre looking for a curious and ambitious Data Engineer who is excited not only about building data pipelines, but you care about how things are built ‚Äì the tooling, the architecture, the reliability and the scalability behind the scenes.¬†

You‚Äôll join a team responsible for the backbone of the data platform that analytics, BI, our AI and ML use cases depend on. We work with a modern data stack, collaborate closely across teams and tackle real-world data problems at scale.¬†

You‚Äôll have room to experiment, bring ideas forward, and actively influence the evolution of our cloud data platform as we grow. If shaping a modern data platform excites you, you‚Äôll feel right at home here.¬†

Are you ready to embark on this journey with us?¬†

As a Data Engineer, you will:¬†

Design, build, and own scalable batch and streaming data pipelines that power analytics, BI, and AI/ML use cases¬†

Shape and evolve our core data platform, contributing to architectural decisions, shared frameworks, and platform tooling¬†

Collaborate closely with analytics, BI, AI, ML and engineering teams to design high-impact, reliable data solutions¬†

Build robust, production-grade data ingestion systems integrating data from diverse internal and external sources¬†

Contribute to improve data reliability and trust through data quality checks, monitoring, alerting, and observability¬†

Work across data integration, storage optimization, and performance tuning to support growth at scale¬†

Support and improve cloud infrastructure for data workloads, including compute, storage, and access control¬†

Proactively monitor, troubleshoot, and resolve pipeline and platform issues using our observability and monitoring tools¬†

Optimize data storage and retrieval for performance and cost efficiency¬†

Stay up to date with emerging data engineering trends and apply modern best practices to continuously improve the platform¬†

Share knowledge and contribute to best practices, supporting team growth and continuous improvement across the team¬†

¬†

You will work hands-on with technologies such as:¬†

Azure Databricks¬†¬†

Azure Data/Delta Lake¬†¬†

Python & PySpark¬†¬†

SQL¬†¬†

Azure DevOps¬†

Monte Carlo (Data Observability)¬†

Azure Data Factory¬†¬†Git¬†¬†

‚Ä¶and more!¬†

¬†

Fuel for your success in the role¬†

You‚Äôre motivated by building high-quality data services and enjoy working in a fast-moving, collaborative environment. You like solving complex problems, care about reliability, and are always curious about better ways to do things.¬†

We‚Äôre looking for someone who brings:¬†

Professional experience in data engineering, analytics engineering, software engineering with a data focus,¬† or a related field

A Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, or a related field

Solid experience working with Python for data processing and automation

Comfort working with Git in a collaborative development workflow¬†

Working knowledge of SQL, including writing queries and performing data transformation tasks.¬†

Experience working in cloud environments (Azure, AWS, or GCP)¬†

Experience with data manipulation and data quality practices, including wrangling, cleansing and validation

Strong problem-solving skills with attention to detail

Excellent communication and collaboration skills¬†

A proactive, continuous-learning mindset¬†

Good written and spoken skills in English¬†

¬†

What makes this role interesting¬†

You‚Äôll work on the core data platform that power analytics and decision-making across the whole Abacus Medicine Group¬†

Exposure to modern data stacks and real-world scale challenges¬†

Opportunities to influence platform architecture decisions as you grow¬†

Hands-on experience with automation, observability, and reliability at scale¬†

¬†

It is an advantage if you have experience or interest in:¬†

Azure Data / Delta Lake for efficient storage and processing of big data

Streaming or event-driven architectures¬†

Data governance, lineage, and access management¬†

Apache Spark and Databricks¬†

PySpark¬†

Orchestration tools¬† (Azure Data Factory, Airflow, etc)¬†

Data modeling and transformation concepts¬†

CI/CD practices.¬†¬†

¬†

Your future colleagues¬†

In the Data, Analytics & AI (D&A) department, we deliver end-to-end capabilities across Data Engineering, Business Intelligence, Advanced Analytics, and AI-driven automation. We are responsible for developing and operating Abacus‚Äô enterprise data hub, including data management, orchestration, and self-service data and BI platforms. Our work spans predictive and prescriptive analytics using OR, ML, and AI, as well as applying AI to optimize workflows and enhance personal productivity across the organization.¬†

The department consists of 29 colleagues with diverse profiles, including Data Scientists, Data Engineers, BI Developers, Data Analysts, GenAI Engineers, and AI Advisors.¬†

‚ÄØ¬†

Our team consists of individuals from diverse nationalities, expertise areas, educational backgrounds, and ownership responsibilities across our data platforms and services. This diversity creates a strong environment for collaboration, technical synergies, and support among units, all while maintaining a positive and motivating work environment.¬†

In summary, our goal is to create innovative data-driven solutions for core business problems within a friendly and professional work setting.¬†

Interested?¬†¬†¬†

If you want to apply for the position, please follow the link and attach your CV and cover letter. ¬†
¬†

Would you like to know more about us?¬†¬†

Follow us on Instagram and LinkedIn and get an insight into everyday life at Abacus Medicine. For job openings, check our Career page.¬†

¬†

Moving Healthcare. Moving You.¬†¬†

In Abacus Medicine Group, you‚Äôll experience the power of Moving Healthcare. With our change mindset, we're moving the industry and improving healthcare as we broaden access to medicine.¬†¬†

But it's not just about moving healthcare, it's about Moving You. You‚Äôll be part of a caring community of more than 1,500 people across the World. With us, you will be valued, empowered, and have a direct impact on driving change. Let's access the future of medicine and make a difference together. Your move.¬†

HTML:
Drive meaningful change  

Are you ready to take your data engineering skills to the next level? This role gives you full ownership of designing, building and scaling data solutions involving pipelines and infrastructure in a modern, cloud-native environment. You‚Äôll work hands-on with cutting-edge technologies, influence platform decisions, and help shape how data drives impact across the company. 

This is a chance to build on our core platform, solve real data challenges, and leave your mark on a growing platform. 

 

Get a glimpse of our world 

We‚Äôre looking for a curious and ambitious Data Engineer who is excited not only about building data pipelines, but you care about how things are built ‚Äì the tooling, the architecture, the reliability and the scalability behind the scenes. 

You‚Äôll join a team responsible for the backbone of the data platform that analytics, BI, our AI and ML use cases depend on. We work with a modern data stack, collaborate closely across teams and tackle real-world data problems at scale. 

You‚Äôll have room to experiment, bring ideas forward, and actively influence the evolution of our cloud data platform as we grow. If shaping a modern data platform excites you, you‚Äôll feel right at home here. 

Are you ready to embark on this journey with us? 

As a Data Engineer, you will: 

  • Design, build, and own scalable batch and streaming data pipelines that power analytics, BI, and AI/ML use cases 

  • Shape and evolve our core data platform, contributing to architectural decisions, shared frameworks, and platform tooling 

  • Collaborate closely with analytics, BI, AI, ML and engineering teams to design high-impact, reliable data solutions 

  • Build robust, production-grade data ingestion systems integrating data from diverse internal and external sources 

  • Contribute to improve data reliability and trust through data quality checks, monitoring, alerting, and observability 

  • Work across data integration, storage optimization, and performance tuning to support growth at scale 

  • Support and improve cloud infrastructure for data workloads, including compute, storage, and access control 

  • Proactively monitor, troubleshoot, and resolve pipeline and platform issues using our observability and monitoring tools 

  • Optimize data storage and retrieval for performance and cost efficiency 

  • Stay up to date with emerging data engineering trends and apply modern best practices to continuously improve the platform 

  • Share knowledge and contribute to best practices, supporting team growth and continuous improvement across the team 

 

You will work hands-on with technologies such as: 

  • Azure Databricks  

  • Azure Data/Delta Lake  

  • Python & PySpark  

  • SQL  

  • Azure DevOps 

  • Monte Carlo (Data Observability) 

  • Azure Data Factory  Git  

  • ‚Ä¶and more! 

 

Fuel for your success in the role 

You‚Äôre motivated by building high-quality data services and enjoy working in a fast-moving, collaborative environment. You like solving complex problems, care about reliability, and are always curious about better ways to do things. 

We‚Äôre looking for someone who brings: 

  • Professional experience in data engineering, analytics engineering, software engineering with a data focus,  or a related field

  • A Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, or a related field

  • Solid experience working with Python for data processing and automation

  • Comfort working with Git in a collaborative development workflow 

  • Working knowledge of SQL, including writing queries and performing data transformation tasks. 

  • Experience working in cloud environments (Azure, AWS, or GCP) 

  • Experience with data manipulation and data quality practices, including wrangling, cleansing and validation

  • Strong problem-solving skills with attention to detail

  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills 

  • A proactive, continuous-learning mindset 

  • Good written and spoken skills in English 

 

What makes this role interesting 

  • You‚Äôll work on the core data platform that power analytics and decision-making across the whole Abacus Medicine Group 

  • Exposure to modern data stacks and real-world scale challenges 

  • Opportunities to influence platform architecture decisions as you grow 

  • Hands-on experience with automation, observability, and reliability at scale 

 

It is an advantage if you have experience or interest in: 

  • Azure Data / Delta Lake for efficient storage and processing of big data

  • Streaming or event-driven architectures 

  • Data governance, lineage, and access management 

  • Apache Spark and Databricks 

  • PySpark 

  • Orchestration tools  (Azure Data Factory, Airflow, etc) 

  • Data modeling and transformation concepts 

  • CI/CD practices.  

 

Your future colleagues 

In the Data, Analytics & AI (D&A) department, we deliver end-to-end capabilities across Data Engineering, Business Intelligence, Advanced Analytics, and AI-driven automation. We are responsible for developing and operating Abacus‚Äô enterprise data hub, including data management, orchestration, and self-service data and BI platforms. Our work spans predictive and prescriptive analytics using OR, ML, and AI, as well as applying AI to optimize workflows and enhance personal productivity across the organization. 

The department consists of 29 colleagues with diverse profiles, including Data Scientists, Data Engineers, BI Developers, Data Analysts, GenAI Engineers, and AI Advisors. 

‚ÄØ 

Our team consists of individuals from diverse nationalities, expertise areas, educational backgrounds, and ownership responsibilities across our data platforms and services. This diversity creates a strong environment for collaboration, technical synergies, and support among units, all while maintaining a positive and motivating work environment. 

In summary, our goal is to create innovative data-driven solutions for core business problems within a friendly and professional work setting. 

Interested?   

If you want to apply for the position, please follow the link and attach your CV and cover letter.  
 

Would you like to know more about us?  

Follow us on Instagram and LinkedIn and get an insight into everyday life at Abacus Medicine. For job openings, check our Career page. 

 

Moving Healthcare. Moving You.  

In Abacus Medicine Group, you‚Äôll experience the power of Moving Healthcare. With our change mindset, we're moving the industry and improving healthcare as we broaden access to medicine.  

But it's not just about moving healthcare, it's about Moving You. You‚Äôll be part of a caring community of more than 1,500 people across the World. With us, you will be valued, empowered, and have a direct impact on driving change. Let's access the future of medicine and make a difference together. Your move.

Title: Senior Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Nepa‚Äôs Customer Success team helps our clients grow their brands and build future success. We take full responsibility for everything we deliver, from insight design and execution to recommendations and follow-through, ensuring that every project creates real, measurable impact for our clients‚Äô businesses. As a senior analyst, you are a key player in our account teams and, together with Project Managers and Account Managers, you act as a trusted advisor to our clients every day.




About the role:




As a Senior Analyst, you take end-to-end responsibility for delivering high-quality analysis - from survey and study design to insight and recommendation - translating data into clear, commercially relevant guidance for our clients.

Your Responsibilities: You will lead analytical work in client projects, manage complex studies independently, and collaborate closely with our client teams to design solutions that address key business challenges and fuel brand growth. This is a hybrid role based in Stockholm or Copenhagen. We believe collaboration and learning happen best in person, so we would like you to be in the office at least three days per week.




As our Senior Analyst, your key responsibilities will include:




Leading client analysis and delivering high-level, business-focused insights
Designing surveys and research setups, ensuring methodology, quality, and validity
Developing and testing innovative analytical approaches within marketing science
Synthesizing complex datasets into clear, actionable insights and recommendations
Participating in client meetings and often leading presentations and workshops
Collaborating closely with account and client teams to understand business challenges and shape analytical solutions
Acting as a trusted advisor together with Project Managers and Account Managers in our account teams
Guiding and mentoring more junior colleagues in analysis, tools, and methodology




Your Profile:




We are looking for a structured, self-motivated team player with strong analytical skills and solid business acumen, who enjoys working hands-on with data to understand consumers and help our clients grow their brands.




To excel in this role, you should have:




Approximately 5+ years of experience in market research, data analytics, consulting, or a similar insights-focused role (e.g. research agency, consulting firm, insights/marketing department)
Strong hands-on skills in data analysis and storytelling, with the ability to turn complex data into clear and compelling narratives
Experience handling senior stakeholders and contributing to strategic and commercial discussions
Fluency in English and Swedish/Danish, both spoken and written
A university degree in business, economics, engineering, statistics or a related field
Advanced skills in Excel; experience with SPSS or R is a strong plus
Strong technical understanding of statistical tools and methodologies
A collaborative mindset and the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams.




A few more details:




‚Äì You believe in the power of data to drive smarter decisions and lasting growth.

‚Äì You share our values: curiosity that sees what others don‚Äôt, passion that shows, clarity over complexity, and the drive to care and act.

‚Äì You take pride in delivering the clarity, speed, and impact our clients rely on.




Who we are:




At Nepa, we help great brands grow by turning insight into action. We connect continuous data with sharp analytics and deep marketing expertise, so businesses can act faster, spend smarter, and focus on what really drives results.

Our platform blends Brand Tracking, Marketing Mix Modelling, and Campaign Evaluation into one clear direction for marketers. With hundreds of brands worldwide relying on us, we‚Äôre trusted to bring clarity to complexity ‚Äì and make insight an engine for growth.




Next Steps:

We review applications on a rolling basis, so don't delay - submit your application today to be considered for this exciting opportunity to join our team as Senior Analyst.

At Nepa, we help great brands grow by turning insight into action. We connect continuous data with sharp analytics and deep marketing expertise, so businesses can act faster, spend smarter, and focus on what really drives results.

Our platform blends Brand Tracking, Marketing Mix Modelling, and Campaign Evaluation into one clear direction for marketers. With hundreds of brands worldwide relying on us, we‚Äôre trusted to bring clarity to complexity ‚Äì and make insight an engine for growth.


Next Steps:

We review applications on a rolling basis, so don't delay - submit your application today to be considered for this exciting opportunity to join our team as Senior Analyst.

Title: Student Assistant for Data Analysis to support API Production
Place: Gladsaxe, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Bagsv√¶rd, Denmark, Onsite

Data & Supply Chain, CMC Pilots

Are you starting your MSc in Engineering and looking to put your theoretical knowledge into practice? Do you want to explore how to combine process knowledge with data analysis to support decision-making in a real-world business setting? If so, we invite you to apply for a Student Assistant position within our Data & Supply Chain team at Novo Nordisk, where you'll collaborate with Pilot Plant scientists and technicians to create innovative PI Vision and PI AF solutions.

Apply today by submitting your CV including a short motivation for joining our team, a separate motivational cover letter is not required.

Your new role

As a Student Assistant in our team, you will play a pivotal role in supporting our Pilot Plants by providing them with essential access to data, visualizations, KPIs, and insights for data-driven decisions. Your responsibilities will include building displays and custom solutions that facilitate better business and process decisions. You will work closely with colleagues eager to learn from your contributions and share valuable insights with you. Your assignments will be influenced by your skillset and commitment to the role.

You may have the opportunity to support and explore areas such as:


Building PI Vision and PI AF solutions
Data visualization and reporting
Time-series data analysis
Bioprocess design and optimization
Enhancing pharmaceutical manufacturing processes


Student Assistant Position Details

A Student Assistant role at Novo Nordisk requires working between 8 ‚Äì 20 hours per week, with most hours on-site. We offer flexibility to accommodate your educational responsibilities, understanding the importance of your studies. A Danish work permit is necessary, and applicants must reside in the Greater Copenhagen Area at the time of application.

Your new department

The Data & Supply Chain team operates within CMC Pilots, where our mission is to deliver active pharmaceutical ingredients (API) for clinical trials. We aim to empower our Pilot Plant colleagues with access to data, visualizations, KPIs, and planning tools to facilitate informed decision-making in our processes.

Your Skills And Qualifications

To be considered for the Student Assistant position, you should:


Be studying towards a Master's degree in Pharmaceutical Drug Design, Chemical Engineering, Process Engineering, Chemistry, Biotechnology or a related field, with at least 24 months left of your studies
Have a foundational understanding of chemical processes and manufacturing
Have a strong willingness to learn and ability to manage your time effectively
Be eager to learn more about data analysis and tools, with previous experience in coding and data analysis being a plus.
Possess a valid work permit to work in Denmark and be available to work on-site.
Be fluent in English, with your CV submitted in English.
Reside in the Greater Copenhagen Area at the time of application.


Working at Novo Nordisk

Every day we seek the solutions that defeat serious chronic diseases. To do this, we approach our work with an unconventional spirit, a rare determination and a constant curiosity. For over 100 years, this unordinary mindset has seen us build a company unlike any other. One where a collective passion for our purpose, mutual respect and a willingness to go beyond what we know delivers extraordinary results.

Deadline

February 15th - 2026

We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants.

At Novo Nordisk, we're not chasing quick fixes ‚Äì we're creating lasting change for long-term health. For over 100 years, we've been driven by a single purpose: to defeat serious chronic diseases and help millions of people live healthier lives. This dedication fuels our constant curiosity and inspires us to push the boundaries of what's possible in healthcare. We embrace diverse perspectives, seek out bold ideas, and build partnerships rooted in shared purpose. Together, we're making healthcare more accessible, treating and preventing diseases, and pioneering solutions that create change spanning generations. When you join us, you become part of something bigger ‚Äì a legacy of impact that reaches far beyond today.

Title: Developer
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Want to build reliable solutions that make an impact for millions of readers? At Aller Media Tech, we build platforms that support some of the strongest media brands in the Nordics.

We‚Äôre looking for a developer to join our Product Platform area and help build the platform behind Aller Media‚Äôs news sites. Ship fast, server-rendered experiences with great performance, clean HTML/CSS, and JavaScript.

This role suits someone who likes simple, durable technology choices, enjoys solving hard problems close to the fundamentals, and wants their work to be felt by millions of readers.

What we offer

You‚Äôll join a Nordic media company with strong brands and real societal impact. You‚Äôll work in product-oriented teams with clear ownership, pragmatic decision-making, and room to influence how we build. We value learning, psychological safety, and collaboration across disciplines.

Aller Media offers exciting technical challenges, knowledge sharing, and a strong focus on personal and professional development with great colleagues. We offer competitive benefits, including pension, health insurance, and flexibility.

What you‚Äôll work on

Your work will span the full stack, including:


Building and evolving server-rendered experiences in Node.js/Express
Working with HTTP, caching strategies, and CDN/edge capabilities (e.g., edge workers)
Writing semantic HTML and modern, framework-independent CSS
Implementing interactive features with functional, framework-free JavaScript
Optimizing client-side performance (Core Web Vitals, loading strategies, rendering cost)
Ensuring accessibility and inclusive design in everyday development
Experience from display advertising, video, or media environments is a plus, but not required.


Where will you be located?

Your office location is either Stockholm, Oslo, or Copenhagen.

Regardless of office affiliation, occasional travel will be required to collaborate with people across Denmark, Sweden, Finland, and Norway. The team has an office-first policy with flexibility.

Ready to apply?

The application deadline is February 10th. Please submit your CV and respond to the questions using the link below.

Only applications submitted via the link will be considered. We conduct interviews on an ongoing basis and may close the posting once the right candidate is found.

We are looking forward to hearing from you!

Title: Graduate Data Scientist
Place: Vester Hassing, North Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
The Company

Veovo is a market leader in Airport Smart Technology. With a global footprint of customers and capabilities that cover Airport Operations, Revenue management and Passenger Flow. Some of the world‚Äôs largest airports rely on Veovo.‚ÄØ Focused on driving airport performance, our solutions enable airports to handle more aircraft and more passengers, with less delays and less queues. Our platforms are built on a modern tech stack, often delivered from the cloud as SaaS and leveraging intelligence to enable our customer to ‚Äúgo brilliantly‚Äù.

Our clients span continents, but all share one thing in common~ they‚Äôre big names in airport excellence, with even bigger digital goals. With offices in the UK,‚ÄØPoland,‚ÄØDenmark, New Zealand and the US,‚ÄØVeovo‚ÄØoffers a world of opportunity

At Veovo we strive to deliver predictable collaborative solutions that are the platform of great airports. At Veovo we strive to deliver predictable collaborative solutions that are the platform of great airports.

The Opportunity

We focus on solutions in the analysis of queue and movement patterns as well as capacity forecasts. Our product, is cloud-based system that collects and analyzes data via proprietary (Bluetooth / WiFi) sensors, as well as third-party data sources such as camera, radar, infrared counters, coils, boarding cards, calendars, etc.

The solution primarily helps airports to forecast passenger appearance, optimize staff resources, reduce queue and travel times, and improve the experience for the passengers. In addition, we also create solutions for road traffic, railway stations, ports, ski resorts and amusement parks, with similar work and end-results.

Are you ready to be part of the team that brings our brilliant solutions "live" around the world?

The size of our installations are growing rapidly, and we are therefore seeking a skilled analytical person, who can help implement our solutions to help airports predict passenger arrival and flow. The implementation covers requirements, design, and calibration of the system. The calibration is carried out in-house via the setup of our filtering engine.

The Specifics


Identify valuable data sources and automate collection processes
Undertake preprocessing of structured and unstructured data
Analyze large amounts of information to discover trends and patterns
Build predictive models and machine-learning algorithms
Combine models through ensemble modeling
Present information using data visualization techniques
Propose solutions and strategies to business challenges
Collaborate with engineering and product development teams


What we are looking for


Knowledge of R, SQL and Python; familiarity with Scala, Java or C++ is an asset
BSc/BA in Computer Science, Engineering or relevant field
Analytical mind and business acumen
Experience in data mining
Problem-solving aptitude
Excellent communication and presentation skills


What we offer in return


A job in a growing industry.
Employment immediately or by agreement.
An exciting position in a company with good working conditions with an open, direct and informal tone
A company where ideas are accelerated into action, and everyone can play a part in the development.
Excellent opportunities for personal and professional development through independent work assignments.
Workplace~ H√¶kken 2, Vester Hassing, 9310 Vodskov
37 hours working week
Show more

Title: Quantitative Analyst - Forward Power
Place: Aarhus, Central Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
Are you an experienced Quantitative Analyst who enjoys turning data, models and ideas into real impact?




We‚Äôre looking for a Quantitative Analyst to join our Forward Power team and work at the intersection of quantitative modelling and power trading.




In this role, you‚Äôll collaborate closely with traders to develop and improve quantitative models, analytics and decision-support tools across forward power markets. You‚Äôll work hands-on with data and production-grade code, contributing throughout the full lifecycle from idea to live implementation in trading.




Our Forward Power team has a clear ambition to become a leading force in the European power markets, and we‚Äôre looking for a quantitative profile who shares that ambition. If you‚Äôre eager to push boundaries and join a team of experienced and driven colleagues, this is your chance.




Let‚Äôs dive into the details!




Your tasks will include

Work closely with traders to develop and refine quantitative models that support profitable trading strategies
Help build and develop stack models for CWE markets
Continuously seek improvements to workflows, analytics, risk tools, and business processes
Conduct ad hoc quick analysis to support trading, risk, and commercial decision-making
Design, develop, and maintain analytic and operational views used for monitoring strategies and market dynamics for trading
Support the development and maintenance of Python-based models
Contribute directly to advancing and scaling our data infrastructure




What we're looking for

Minimum 2 years of experience as a Quantitative Analyst, preferably within Forward Power or Day-Ahead
Hold a Master within a quantitative field
You have strong quantitative, analytical, and problem-solving skills
You have great Python knowledge and an eagerness to code. Experience with other code languages is considered an advantage
You‚Äôre a strong team player with a pragmatic, execution-focused mindset
You‚Äôre driven, take ownership, and are willing to challenge the status quo to create impact




What we offer

A young, dynamic, ambitious and fun work environment
Extensive opportunities for personal development and career growth. You will be given responsibility from day one and receive close sparring with skilled colleagues
The opportunity to contribute and make your mark on a young company‚Äôs development
A competitive salary package
A fun and social work environment with events such as Friday bars, poker tournaments, summer and Christmas parties etc. throughout the year. We also offer weekly sports activities to boost team spirit, such as our Nitor-running club!
Delicious lunch arrangement with food from Meyers in our own canteen
Brand new office facilities located in the heart of Aarhus, right next to Dokk1 and Letbanen




Expected start date: As soon as possible

Please note that we review applications on a rolling basis and may close the position early if we find the right candidate.







About Nitor Energy

Nitor Energy is a fast-growing energy trading company, that has swiftly transitioned from start-up to scale-up within just a few years. We‚Äôre experiencing rapid growth, offering limitless opportunities for learning and development. We‚Äôre proud of who we are and excited about what we‚Äôre building for the future together. Our employees thrive on challenges and are motivated by the potential that lies ahead.




Our unique culture integrates traders, coders, and analysts into cohesive teams, creating a well-rounded approach to our success. We believe in a balanced work-life dynamic and foster a vibrant, engaging atmosphere where our employees can excel in every aspect.

Title: Data Engineer or Applied AI Specialist
Place: Copenhagen Metropolitan Area
Description:
Join CM Biomass and turn complex data challenges into impactful solutions that accelerate the green transition in the global biomass market.




About the team

Become part of our international data team in Copenhagen. We are a small team of 3-4 people, each with end-to-end responsibility - from understanding the business problem to building and operating the solution. We work in an open, collaborative environment where there is plenty of dialogue and room for having fun, and we expect the same from you.




We stay close to the latest developments in data and AI and are not afraid to test new approaches when they create value. You will collaborate across the organization - from traders to executive leadership ‚Äì to deliver solutions that improve efficiency and enable real innovation, helping us optimize the company in the transition toward sustainable energy.




Build solutions and unlock business value

Over the past years, we have built a fully cloud-based platform on Azure, with nearly all data workloads running in Microsoft Fabric as part of our carve-out from a legacy on-prem setup. The platform has matured alongside the organization, and we are now ready for the next step: using data and AI to solve real business problems - not building chatbots no one needs.




We already apply AI/ML to automate document flows (OCR), analyse satellite imagery, aggregate market signals, and monitor competitor activity. Your role is to turn ideas into reliable, scalable solutions that enhance performance, streamline processes, support trading insights, and detect anomalies before they become real issues.




Your responsibilities include:

Develop and maintain data pipelines and ML workflows in azure and on our Fabric platform.
Build applied AI solutions that solve commercial and operational problems.
Move prototypes to production with short time-to-value while maintaining data quality and scalability.
Collaborate with stakeholders to identify and prioritize high-value opportunities.
Work pragmatically across BI, data engineering, and applied AI - using the best tools for each challenge.




Empowering innovation through data

‚ÄúHere, you will work pragmatically across classical BI, data engineering, and applied AI. We use whatever solves the problem best - AI when it creates real value, simple pipelines when that is the smarter choice. The outcome matters more than the tool. If you are motivated by turning real business problems into solutions that actually make it into production, you will have the chance to make a tangible impact - and have a lot of fun in the process,‚Äú says August Godballe, Head of Data & AI, CM Biomass




Skilled and adaptable within data & applied AI

The ideal candidate has hands-on experience with modern data engineering, cloud technologies, and applied AI - and enjoys creating solutions that make a measurable impact. Industry experience is a plus, but curiosity and fast learning matter just as much.




Preferably, you have:

A Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in data science, computer science, engineering, or similar
2‚Äì3 years of experience in data engineering and applied AI (ML, computer vision, automation, etc.)
Strong SQL skills and proficiency in at least one programming language
Experience with cloud platforms (Fabric, Azure, Databricks, or similar)
Ability to deliver end-to-end solutions.
Professional proficiency in English




Join the Journey

If this sounds like the right fit, we encourage you to apply promptly. Applications are reviewed on a rolling basis, and interviews are expected to take place in January.




If you have any questions regarding the position, you are welcome to contact August Godballe, Head of Data & AI, at +45 31 17 10 94




CM Biomass is the world‚Äôs largest trader of wood pellets and a top 5 producer, employs more than 240 skilled professionals in 13 countries and works with a variety of clients across several markets trading annually around 3.6 million tons of wood pellets and agricultural residues striving to decarbonize power and heat production




CM Biomass' majority owner is the family-owned United Shipping & Trading Company (USTC), which is represented in 38 countries via the group's activities within fuel [oil] & energy, shipping & logistics, risk management, car activities, IT and sustainable energy.

CM Biomass' majority owner is the family-owned United Shipping & Trading Company (USTC), which is represented in 38 countries via the group's activities within fuel [oil] & energy, shipping & logistics, risk management, car activities, IT and sustainable energy.

Title: Lead Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Lead Data Engineer - v√¶r med til at forme fundamentet for Ledernes dataplatform




Om rollen

EPICO s√∏ger p√• vegne af Lederne en Lead Data Engineer, der bliver det faglige anker for organisationens dataplatform og dataarkitektur.




Lederne er en moderne medlemsorganisation i forandring, hvor data spiller en central rolle for rapportering, beslutningsst√∏tte og videre digital udvikling. I denne rolle f√•r du et stort teknisk ansvar og reel indflydelse p√•, hvordan data designes, struktureres og anvendes p√• tv√¶rs af organisationen.




Du indg√•r i et fagligt ambiti√∏st milj√∏, hvor kvalitet, datasikkerhed og robuste l√∏sninger er afg√∏rende, og hvor du f√•r mulighed for b√•de at s√¶tte retning og selv v√¶re dybt involveret i de tekniske l√∏sninger.




Din hverdag

Du har det overordnede tekniske ansvar for Ledernes dataplatform og fungerer som den, organisationen og teamet l√¶ner sig op ad, n√•r det g√¶lder dataarkitektur, modellering og komplekse dataflows.




En stor del af dit arbejde ligger i at designe, videreudvikle og kvalitetssikre datamodeller og SQL-baserede l√∏sninger, som bruges direkte til rapportering og analyse i v√¶rkt√∏jer som Power BI og Tableau.




Du arbejder hands-on med komplekse SQL-foresp√∏rgsler, performanceoptimering og strukturering af data, s√• platformen er stabil, skalerbar og let at bygge videre p√•. Samtidig har du fokus p√• datasikkerhed, korrekt h√•ndtering af adgang, datakvalitet og governance, s√• data kan bruges ansvarligt og p√•lideligt.




Du sparrer t√¶t med b√•de data engineers, BI-udviklere og forretningen og hj√¶lper med at oms√¶tte behov for rapportering og indsigt til solide tekniske l√∏sninger. Rollen handler ikke kun om at bygge nyt, men i h√∏j grad om at sikre, at fundamentet er st√¶rkt og rigtigt bygget.




Hvem er du?

Du har en solid baggrund i SQL og datamodellering og har arbejdet professionelt med moderne dataplatforme, gerne med afs√¶t i BI og rapportering, hvor du naturligt er vokset over i data engineering og platformansvar.




Du motiveres af at skabe orden, struktur og kvalitet i data og tager naturligt ansvar for, at l√∏sningerne holder, ogs√• p√• den lange bane.




Fagligt ser vi gerne, at du:

Har tung erfaring med SQL og datamodellering i praksis
Har arbejdet med Snowflake eller tilsvarende cloud-dataplatforme
Har erfaring med data til rapportering og analyse i Power BI, Tableau eller lignende
Har solid forst√•else for dataarkitektur, dataflows og performance
Har fokus p√• datasikkerhed, adgangsstyring og god dataorden
Har erfaring med at arbejde t√¶t sammen med b√•de BI, forretning og tekniske teams




Om Lederne

Lederne er en markant medlemsorganisation med h√∏je ambitioner for brugen af teknologi og data. Organisationen er i gang med en omfattende digital transformation, hvor data udg√∏r et centralt fundament for rapportering, beslutningsst√∏tte og fremtidige digitale initiativer.




Kulturen er pr√¶get af faglighed, samarbejde og √∏nsket om at skabe reel v√¶rdi for medlemmerne.




Vil du vide mere?

Rekrutteringsprocessen varetages af Epico og du kan h√∏re mere om stillingen hos Senior Business Manager Pauline Christiansen p√• telefon: +45 53 74 71 53 eller pac@epicosearch.dk.

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Welcome to IO Interactive, where we shape worlds, stories, and adventures for players around the globe. Now, we‚Äôre looking for our next adventurer: a Data Engineer to join our centralized Business Intelligence team.

You‚Äôll be joining a team that genuinely enjoys working together. We are a group known for curiosity, collaboration, and a great sense of humor. Most of the team is based in Copenhagen, but we work seamlessly across all our studios. You‚Äôll be stepping into an environment where people support each other, share knowledge openly, and have fun while tackling complex data challenges.

This is not just a support role. As a Data Engineer at IO Interactive, you will help shape how we understand our players, our games, and our business. You will turn raw information into meaningful, actionable intelligence that empowers our teams to make smarter decisions, from post‚Äëlaunch game performance to commercial insights to financial forecasting across all of IO Interactive.

This is a role for someone curious, grounded, collaborative, and capable of navigating ambiguity. You enjoy understanding the problem before rushing to the solution, and you can translate complex technical topics into clear, accessible insights for non‚Äëtechnical stakeholders.

If you want your work to directly influence iconic, industry‚Äëdefining games, while being part of a genuinely warm, international, and fun team, then you are our new companion, and this is the adventure for you.

This position is open in our Malm√∂, Copenhagen, Brighton, and Barcelona studios. We offer a welcoming and great studio culture with a hybrid setup of 4 days in the studio and 1 optional remote day.

What You Will Do


Take ownership of ongoing and new BI projects, including:
Finance: financial dashboards, cashflow monitoring, budget allocation dashboards, assignment plan insights, salary review dashboards etc.
Games: post‚Äërelease game analytics for Hitman and 007 First Light, game performance dashboards, player behavior insights, hardware usage analytics etc.
Commercial: commercial insights and reporting across the IO Interactive portfolio.
Identify, collaborate, and enable data collection requirements across finance, commercial, and game analytics domains.
Build, maintain, and optimize robust data processing pipelines with consideration for data protection laws, cost, and scalability.
Implement dashboards and ensure stakeholders are onboarded and empowered to use them effectively.
Monitor pipeline health, troubleshoot issues, and ensure reliable data availability.
Contribute to BI team initiatives that enhance tooling, processes, prioritization, and data culture across IOI.


Who You Are


Several years of experience working in Data Engineering, Data Analytics, or Business Intelligence, ideally within the financial or tech industry.
Experience working with financial and commercial analytics, such as P&L reports, cash flow analysis, revenue monitoring, and multinational financial structures.
Comfortable working with data warehouses, databases, ETL/ELT pipelines, and dashboarding tools.
Experience automating data extraction from RESTful APIs. Knowledge of Python or .NET is helpful.
Practical experience with SQL and data processing techniques.
A degree in a relevant field such as data science, computer science, information systems, software engineering, statistics, applied mathematics, finance, or a related discipline.


We Would Love It If You Have


Experience with Microsoft data stack is a plus: Azure Synapse, Data Factory, Azure SQL, Fabric, Power BI, Blob Storage.
Experience in Google Cloud, AWS, or equivalent ecosystems is also valued.


Who We Are

IO Interactive is an independent videogame development and publishing company with studios in Copenhagen, Malm√∂, Barcelona, Istanbul, and Brighton. As the creative force behind some of the most talked-about multiplatform video games in the last decade, we are committed to creating unforgettable characters and experiences ‚Äì all powered by our award-winning, proprietary Glacier technology.

IOI is a studio that values in-person collaboration. Being together helps us focus our collective energy on our immediate goals. For us, being both in-office and connected across our studios helps us integrate our teams faster, strengthen relationships, and improve knowledge-sharing. We believe that the more time we spend together, the more quality and progress we achieve for our games and players.

We know that to achieve those goals, we need courage, talented people, and a great working environment ‚Äì and we do our utmost to have all of that. Across our multiple studios, we‚Äôre working on several projects. Crucially, though, we‚Äôre all one team. We value the work and impact that each person brings to the table, and we actively encourage new ideas, whilst listening to your insights along the way.

We have a dedicated team of People Managers, who look after you as an individual and as an employee. With more than 40 nationalities, we know that everyone is different and we are proud to have a reputation for being a friendly workplace with highly-talent people.

IO Interactive is an independent video game development and publishing company with studios in Copenhagen, Malm√∂, Barcelona, Brighton and Istanbul. As the creative force behind some of the most talked-about multiplatform video games in the last decade, we are dedicated to creating unforgettable characters and experiences ‚Äì all powered by our award-winning proprietary Glacier technology.

Title: Digitalisation Intern
Place: Hiller√∏d, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Business Support, FPMSAT

Hiller√∏d, Denmark

Teaser

Are you passionate about turning data into meaningful insights and improving the way organisations work? Join us as our new Digitalisation Intern and help shape smarter tools, smoother processes, and better decision‚Äëmaking across Business Support.

Your new role

In this role, you will support our digitalisation agenda by enhancing and developing Business Intelligence solutions and contributing to key improvement initiatives across FPMSAT.

Day‚Äëto‚Äëday, You Can Expect To


Maintain and improve existing Business Intelligence (BI) tools and dashboards.
Build, update and develop new Power BI reports to support strategic and operational decisions.
Prepare, clean, transform and analyse data to ensure high‚Äëquality reporting.
Collaborate closely with business units to understand reporting needs and define KPIs.
Troubleshoot data connectivity, report accuracy and user‚Äëexperience challenges.
Support project management tasks, including data standardisation and process optimisation.
Drive small improvement projects independently with guidance from your mentor.
Help plan, organise and facilitate meetings, knowledge‚Äësharing sessions and cross‚Äëfunctional forums.


Your new department

You will join Business Support (BS) within FPMSAT, a unit dedicated to enabling the organisation to deliver on its purpose, strategy and long-term ambitions. Business Support drives cross‚Äëfunctional processes within Strategy, Finance, Lean, Innovation, Training, and Portfolio Management & Business Development.

The team combines operational excellence with a strong drive for continuous improvement. You will contribute to strengthening our digital solutions and ensuring our stakeholders have access to reliable insights that support better ways of working.

Your Skills & Qualifications

You are a motivated and curious student who enjoys solving problems with data and using digital tools to improve processes. You have a strong analytical mindset and feel comfortable working both independently and in collaboration with others. Ideally, you bring:


You are currently studying a MSc degree within IT, Computer Science, Data Science, Information Systems or a related field.
Experience or interest in project management.
Experience with Power BI, data transformation and/or dashboard development is an advantage.
Strong analytical skills and a structured approach to problem‚Äësolving.
Ability to communicate clearly, collaborate with stakeholders, and work in a dynamic environment.
Previous work experience is considered an advantage.


Working at Novo Nordisk

Every day we seek the solutions that defeat serious chronic diseases. To do this, we approach our work with determination, constant curiosity and a commitment to finding better ways forward. For over 100 years, this dedication has shaped a company built on innovation, diverse thinking and shared purpose. When you join us, you become part of a community that values mutual respect, continuous learning and meaningful impact.

What We Offer

Here, opportunities to learn and grow are woven into every day. As part of a global healthcare company, you'll gain hands‚Äëon experience with digital tools, access a wide international network, and work in a culture designed to support your development and wellbeing.

More information

If you would like to know more about the role, please reach out to the hiring team via the contact information provided in the job posting.

Deadline

10th of February.

We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants.

At Novo Nordisk, we're not chasing quick fixes ‚Äì we're creating lasting change for long-term health. For over 100 years, we've been driven by a single purpose: to defeat serious chronic diseases and help millions of people live healthier lives. This dedication fuels our constant curiosity and inspires us to push the boundaries of what's possible in healthcare. We embrace diverse perspectives, seek out bold ideas, and build partnerships rooted in shared purpose. Together, we're making healthcare more accessible, treating and preventing diseases, and pioneering solutions that create change spanning generations. When you join us, you become part of something bigger ‚Äì a legacy of impact that reaches far beyond today.

Title: Senior Product Analyst - Revenue Enablement Group
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Veo is a global leader in AI-based sports camera technology. Our innovative, fully automatic camera solution enables sports teams to record matches and training sessions without a camera operator. We‚Äôre democratizing the world of sports by granting video analysis for teams on all levels‚Äîa privilege that used to be only for the few. More than 40,000 clubs in 90+ countries record their games every week.

But what truly sets us apart? Our people. We‚Äôre a diverse group of innovative thinkers, creators, and problem-solvers who believe in delivering an incredible product‚Äîand having fun while doing it.

The Opportunity

We're looking for a Senior Product Analyst to join our Product Analytics Team, the group responsible for building strong instrumentation and using data to enable better product decisions across Veo. In this role, you will be embedded within the Revenue Enablement Group in the Product & Engineering department, focusing on the data and analytics that power our subscription & billing, CRM, and e-commerce ecosystems.

While your reporting home and peer group will be the Product Analytics Team, your day-to-day partnership will be with Product and Engineering leaders across our Monetisation, Business Optimisation, and Revenue Platform teams.

You will shape the analytical framework for the group by refining KPIs, maintaining metric consistency, sizing commercial opportunities, and uncovering insights that improve operational efficiency and funnel conversion.

Veo is at an early and exciting stage in establishing a shared understanding of metrics, baselines, and drivers. You will play a key role in ensuring robust instrumentation and tracking, and in building reusable, goal-aligned metrics that create clarity and consistency across teams.

What You Will Do:



Work with data across Zuora, Salesforce, and our e-commerce platform to surface clear insights, define and monitor key revenue metrics, and quantify commercial and operational opportunities
Partner with our e-commerce (Monetisation) team to refine KPIs, improve funnel and conversion visibility, ensure accurate tracking, and and uncover insights that inform our self-service purchase flows and overall checkout performance
Define, implement, and maintain the metrics that align with product and revenue goals - ensuring they‚Äôre reusable, well-documented, and widely understood across teams and departments
Conduct deep-dive analyses to validate revenue and product opportunities
Oversee proper tracking for product features. Validate, test, and document analytics events to ensure accurate and consistent data collection
Collaborate with Product and Engineering to establish experimentation methods, test design, and instrumentation requirements for revenue-related initiatives
Ensure all relevant teams - product, marketing, engineering, etc. - have access to meaningful insights that guide decision-making and align with our business objectives
Work alongside data engineering to improve dbt models and pipeline clarity




What You Could Bring


5+ years of professional experience in a data analytics role, ideally within SaaS, sports technology, or other analytics-driven products
Solid experience with setting up event tracking and instrumenting features (we use Segment)
Experience working with subscription and billing systems (e.g., Zuora), CRM tools (e.g., Salesforce), and familiarity with e-commerce data
Proven ability to handle ad-hoc requests, manage stakeholder expectations, and deliver actionable insights
Strong experience based knowledge in SQL and Python (or similar language)
Acumen on product intuition
Experience with BigQuery, Steep/Count (BI tools), Amplitude, Segment or similar tools is a plus
Commercial mindset with the ability to translate ambiguous revenue questions into clear analytical recommendations
Track record of translating complex analyses into actionable recommendations
Experience setting up and running experiments
Full professional proficiency in English




Our Copenhagen office mirrors our innovative technology ‚Äì with an indoor ball court, rooftop terrace, and well-equipped gym. We have created a facility that supports connecting disciplines across the business, facilitates creative thinking, and gives the space to engage with colleagues, our global partners, and the entire Veo community.

Values we hold at Veo:

Dare - We take initiative, stay curious, and challenge the status quo in our work.

Own it - We drive impact by identifying opportunities, taking responsibility, and confidently executing.

Level up - We embrace growth, continuously learning and shaping our skills.

Play as a team - We collaborate across a diverse organization, leveraging shared insights for stronger outcomes.

Customer Centric - We deliver value by having close partnerships and a deep understanding of our customers (internally and externally)

We value diversity and inclusion and welcome applicants from all backgrounds, even if your experience doesn‚Äôt completely match every qualification listed. What matters most is your creativity, potential, and ability to contribute meaningfully.
