The Opportunity

We're looking for a Senior Product Analyst to join our Product Analytics Team, the group responsible for building strong instrumentation and using data to enable better product decisions across Veo. In this role, you will be embedded within the Revenue Enablement Group in the Product & Engineering department, focusing on the data and analytics that power our subscription & billing, CRM, and e-commerce ecosystems.

While your reporting home and peer group will be the Product Analytics Team, your day-to-day partnership will be with Product and Engineering leaders across our Monetisation, Business Optimisation, and Revenue Platform teams.

You will shape the analytical framework for the group by refining KPIs, maintaining metric consistency, sizing commercial opportunities, and uncovering insights that improve operational efficiency and funnel conversion.

Veo is at an early and exciting stage in establishing a shared understanding of metrics, baselines, and drivers. You will play a key role in ensuring robust instrumentation and tracking, and in building reusable, goal-aligned metrics that create clarity and consistency across teams.

What You Will Do:


  • Work with data across Zuora, Salesforce, and our e-commerce platform to surface clear insights, define and monitor key revenue metrics, and quantify commercial and operational opportunities
  • Partner with our e-commerce (Monetisation) team to refine KPIs, improve funnel and conversion visibility, ensure accurate tracking, and and uncover insights that inform our self-service purchase flows and overall checkout performance
  • Define, implement, and maintain the metrics that align with product and revenue goals - ensuring they‚Äôre reusable, well-documented, and widely understood across teams and departments
  • Conduct deep-dive analyses to validate revenue and product opportunities
  • Oversee proper tracking for product features. Validate, test, and document analytics events to ensure accurate and consistent data collection
  • Collaborate with Product and Engineering to establish experimentation methods, test design, and instrumentation requirements for revenue-related initiatives
  • Ensure all relevant teams - product, marketing, engineering, etc. - have access to meaningful insights that guide decision-making and align with our business objectives
  • Work alongside data engineering to improve dbt models and pipeline clarity



What You Could Bring

  • 5+ years of professional experience in a data analytics role, ideally within SaaS, sports technology, or other analytics-driven products
  • Solid experience with setting up event tracking and instrumenting features (we use Segment)
  • Experience working with subscription and billing systems (e.g., Zuora), CRM tools (e.g., Salesforce), and familiarity with e-commerce data
  • Proven ability to handle ad-hoc requests, manage stakeholder expectations, and deliver actionable insights
  • Strong experience based knowledge in SQL and Python (or similar language)
  • Acumen on product intuition
  • Experience with BigQuery, Steep/Count (BI tools), Amplitude, Segment or similar tools is a plus
  • Commercial mindset with the ability to translate ambiguous revenue questions into clear analytical recommendations
  • Track record of translating complex analyses into actionable recommendations
  • Experience setting up and running experiments
  • Full professional proficiency in English



Our Copenhagen office mirrors our innovative technology ‚Äì with an indoor ball court, rooftop terrace, and well-equipped gym. We have created a facility that supports connecting disciplines across the business, facilitates creative thinking, and gives the space to engage with colleagues, our global partners, and the entire Veo community.

Values we hold at Veo:

Dare - We take initiative, stay curious, and challenge the status quo in our work.

Own it - We drive impact by identifying opportunities, taking responsibility, and confidently executing.

Level up - We embrace growth, continuously learning and shaping our skills.

Play as a team - We collaborate across a diverse organization, leveraging shared insights for stronger outcomes.

Customer Centric - We deliver value by having close partnerships and a deep understanding of our customers (internally and externally)

We value diversity and inclusion and welcome applicants from all backgrounds, even if your experience doesn‚Äôt completely match every qualification listed. What matters most is your creativity, potential, and ability to contribute meaningfully.

Title: Analytics Engineer
Place: Copenhagen Metropolitan Area
Description:
We are looking for an Analytics Engineer to join our Digital & Business Development team. Our team sits at the intersection of technology, data, and business strategy, and is where innovation happens at Sams√∏e Sams√∏e. You will join a diverse team including data engineers, analysts, and project managers working on data strategy, IT for business, omnichannel operations, and business strategy implementation. We are a team that learns together, embraces new challenges, and believes that solving complex problems should be both engaging and enjoyable.

You will be joining at an exciting point in the data team. We are evaluating next-generation data platforms, implementing AI-powered tools, and building the analytics infrastructure that will support the company's growth for years to come.

You will play a crucial role in evaluating and potentially modernising our data infrastructure while supporting day-to-day analytics needs across the organisation. This is an opportunity to work on meaningful technical challenges in the fashion retail industry, balancing hands-on engineering with business impact.




RESPONSIBILITIES

Data engineering and modelling (60%)

Participate in our data platform modernisation initiative, currently evaluating alternatives to our Azure stack through proof-of-concept development.
Help assess and compare solutions including Microsoft Fabric, MotherDuck, and BigQuery to achieve performance targets.
Build and maintain ELT pipelines connecting a best-of-breed IT landscape.
Work on dimensional modeling and medallion architecture patterns.
Own the transformation layer using SQL.
Optimise data models serving 100+ Power BI users.
Help Sams√∏e Sams√∏e moving towards Conversational Analytics through semantic layer.

Analytics and stakeholder support (40%)

Collaborate with business users to understand needs and structure data models answering them.
Support data governance and documentation initiatives.
Help upskill team members and business users on SQL and analytics best practices.
Develop analytics across the value chain supporting use-cases like demand forecasting and buying decisions.




YOUR PROFILE

Required

2-3 years of experience in analytics engineering, data engineering, or similar roles.
Strong SQL skills and experience with dimensional modelling.
Experience with ELT/ETL tools and orchestration frameworks.
Familiarity with cloud data platforms (Azure, AWS, or GCP).
Interest into the retail or fashion value chain.
Comfortable working with business stakeholders to translate needs into technical solutions.

Nice to have

Experience with dbt, Dagster, or similar modern data tools.
Former experience with retail or fashion data modelling.
Power BI or other BI tool expertise.
Proficiency in Python for data processing.




WE OFFER YOU

The opportunity to influence major technical decisions during our platform evaluation phase and gain architectural experience.
To work on infrastructure optimisation with real impact.
Exposure to the full data stack - from pipelines to business insights.
A collaborative team environment with focus on learning and skill development.
Generous staff discounts on Sams√∏e Sams√∏e collections.
A central Copenhagen location.




If this sounds like the right fit, please send your CV and if possible, your repository with examples of projects you have worked on.

If you have any questions regarding the job offer, please reach out to Maxime Roux, Head of Digital & Business Development, on LinkedIn or by email roux@samsoe.com.




We are committed to creating a diverse environment and encourage anyone to apply for the position, regardless of nationality, race, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, disability, or age.




WHO ARE WE?

Our story, brand, and vision

Sams√∏e Sams√∏e dates back to 1993, when a small jewellery shop opened in Copenhagen‚Äôs Latin Quarter. The label soon expanded to include premium T-shirts and knitwear, primarily for men. In 2000, the current owners took over the brand, transforming it into an international fashion house focusing on contemporary clothes, footwear and accessories for men and women.

With a nod to its Scandinavian heritage, Sams√∏e Sams√∏e is defined by a wearable aesthetic that combines the utilitarian ease of Copenhagen street style with a quintessentially Scandinavian spirit. Collections transcend trends, drawing on Denmark‚Äôs renowned design tradition to result in minimalist, affordable and accessible fashion.

Title: Senior Game Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
It‚Äôs an exciting time to join Tactile. We're a diverse team of storytellers, puzzle enthusiasts, and casual mobile game creators. Our story began in 2008 in the heart of beautiful Copenhagen, and since then, we have experienced continuous growth, establishing ourselves as one of the largest gaming companies in Denmark. In more recent years, we have been scaling fast, in large part thanks to the success of a little game called Lily‚Äôs Garden. Now we‚Äôre on a mission to solidify our position as one of the leaders in creating out-of-the-ordinary casual puzzle games.




üöÄ Your role & impact




We are currently expanding our Analytics team and are seeking a Senior Game Analyst to support our Product and LiveOps functions.




Our analysts are embedded directly within our game teams, ensuring each team has dedicated experts who understand the intricacies of data and their unique needs. Your role will be crucial in validating decisions with data, offering valuable insights to shape product roadmaps, and fostering a culture of backing up decisions with data. This means you will have a tangible impact on the game and contribute to enhancing our players‚Äô experience.




So, if you are super passionate about games or mobile tech and have data deeply embedded in your DNA, then you might be our missing piece! üß©




üìç This role is based in our Copenhagen office, as we genuinely believe that when talented people work closely together, amazing things happen! We offer full relocation support and are open to candidates across Europe who are willing to relocate.




Here‚Äôs what you'll do on the day-to-day:

Analyse the performance of the game to help the Product/LiveOps team understand player behaviour, what to improve in the game, and what the estimated impact of each improvement is
Create compelling dashboards that support decision-making and monitor key metrics of the game
Lead the design and analysis of A/B tests and run experiments with the Product and LiveOps team, and turn results into clear recommendations
Partner with game designers and product specialists to balance game features using data
Partner with developers to define tracking requirements and ensure high-quality event-based data
Present insights to stakeholders and influence product roadmap and LiveOps decisions by proposing clear courses of action
Collaborate with the rest of the game analysts on the team and drive shared approaches to solving problems




What we‚Äôre looking for:

4+ years of experience as an analyst in mobile games or free-to-play products
Proven experience supporting live games with continuous LiveOps, feature releases, and experimentation
Strong understanding of player behaviour across the full lifecycle, including retention, progression, engagement, and monetisation
Demonstrated ownership of game KPIs and the ability to influence product or LiveOps decisions through data
Advanced SQL skills and experience working with large, event-based datasets
Strong experience designing, analysing, and interpreting A/B tests and long-running experiments
Solid applied statistics knowledge, including hypothesis testing, sampling, and experiment design
Experience translating complex analyses into clear recommendations for non-technical stakeholders
Hands-on experience with data visualisation tools such as Looker or Tableau, with a focus on decision-making rather than reporting
Working knowledge of Python or R for analysis, experimentation, or automation




What‚Äôs in it for you?

üåÜ Beautiful office space with probably the best view in Copenhagen

ü©∫ Pension and private health insurance

üíª A chance to work with the latest tools and technology

üìö Opportunities for individual growth with development talks as well as workshops, books and courses

üåÆ Daily, healthy organic breakfast and lunch prepared by our professional chefs in-house

ü•≥ Social activities, including game nights, book club, Friday bar and more

‚úàÔ∏è Relocation package if you are coming from outside of Denmark

üîç Free Danish lessons with our in-house Danish teacher




Our interview process

Submit your application via the fill-in form at the top of this page. This is the easiest and fastest way to get in touch with our recruiters. We foster an inclusive culture and accessible workplace, and want to make sure we provide everyone with the same opportunities for success. This is why we encourage you to apply regardless of your gender, sexuality, age, nationality, neurodiversity or disability. We review applications based on competencies and experience, so please do tell us about your favourite projects and technologies.




After we review your application, you can expect to go through the following conversations:

‚òï Introductory chat with one of our Recruiters to make sure we‚Äôre aligned on the scope of the role

üëã Introductory conversation with Alex or Norberto, our Analytics leadership, to dive into the technical details of the role

üß™ A test assignment, to see your skills in action.

üöÄ Follow-up technical interview, in which you will meet with the team, present & discuss your test solutions




Please follow the link to read more about our game analytics approach.




We look forward to receiving your application! üëã

Title: Internship, Finance Systems & Business Intelligence, Lystrup
Place: Lystrup, Central Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to kickstart your career in an international high-tech company, operating within highly specialized areas like aerospace, defense, security and space? Global Finance offers a unique opportunity for a passionate student who wants to be part of an internal people pipeline. Come and join us!




We are facing an exciting future with considerable growth and demanding changes, as we deliver advanced technologies and mission critical solutions for the defense and aerospace industry. Our systems provide security for people on land, at sea and in the air. Therefore, we are looking for an intern to our Power BI team in Global Finance to become part of this journey and contribute to our overall purpose ‚Äì securing people through advanced technology.




Join us: Fall 2026

Application deadline: 31/03/2026




Your role in our team




As our new intern in Global Finance, Power BI, you will experience a variety of tasks and have the opportunity to apply your theoretical knowledge in practice. You will engage in strategic projects, data analysis, and financial management within a dynamic, high-tech environment, and grow professionally alongside other passionate interns and students as part of our internal talent pipeline.




We offer an exciting opportunity to begin building your dream career, with a strong focus on both professional and personal development. You will have the chance to make your own mark in an international, innovation-driven company, working closely with highly skilled colleagues on meaningful projects.




In Global Finance, we pride ourselves on maintaining an open working environment where colleagues help each other stay focused, committed, and motivated to deliver value across the organization. You will gain hands-on experience, collaborate across functions, and be part of a team where technology, strategy, and continuous improvement drive everything we do.




How you will make a meaningful contribution




Your key responsibilities include:

Ensuring secure and structured data management
Preparing, cleaning, and transforming data for analysis
Assisting in designing and developing Power BI reports and dashboards
Performing data validation and troubleshooting to ensure report accuracy
Supporting the automation of recurring reports




Bring your world class expertise into play




We welcome students from diverse academic backgrounds who are passionate about contributing to a high-tech company and making an impact. Candidates may be pursuing a master‚Äôs degree in fields such as:

Data Science
Computer Science
Business Intelligence
Or similar field of study




Moreover, we are also looking for a new colleague with the following qualifications:

Has a can-do attitude and is motivated by applying theoretical knowledge in practice
Is self-driven and able to manage multiple tasks simultaneously
Pays close attention to detail and consistently produces high-quality work
Has a positive attitude and thrives as a team player
Can deliver effective results, meeting deadlines and targets
Is fluent in English, both written and spoken




The key points to success in our team are to show commitment, work with passion both in groups and independently, an outgoing and proactive personality, curiosity, as well as showing initiative in the daily work. You solve your tasks by setting deadlines and with strong focus on quality and detail, of course in close cooperation with your colleagues. You work in a structured manner, make things happen and identify and deal with issues proactively. You are a good communicator and understand the importance of cross-functional cooperation.




We are an international company representing world-class expertise, delivering complex and high-tech products. We value our colleagues and our meaningful contributions to securing people through advanced technology. You will also experience that we have a strong focus on your development, teaching you useful new competences and further strengthening current ones, both professionally and personally. Our company culture is autonomous and engaging, and we acknowledge the importance of flexibility in a great working environment.

When joining Terma, we promise that you will experience: Great people, challenging tasks, world-class expertise, and meaningful contribution in your daily work.




__________________________________________________________________________________




We are dedicated to fostering a diverse, equitable, inclusive, and welcoming workplace. Our commitment to DEIB (Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Belonging) means we actively value and celebrate unique backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences. We strive to create an environment where all employees have equal opportunities to succeed, feel respected and valued, and experience a true sense of belonging.

To support an unbiased evaluation process, we kindly encourage applicants to omit personal details such as photos and age from their applications.




If you would like to take on the challenge of working in an innovative company, we look forward to receiving your application. A resume is required, while a cover letter is optional. To ensure that your application will reach us and is properly processed, we only accept applications via www.terma.com. Applications will be processed continuously.




__________________________________________________________________________________




Do you have any questions regarding the position?




Feel free to contact Hiring Manager on e-mail: CLCA@terma.com




Bear in mind, that we need you to confirm that you can obtain a security clearance by the Danish Defense Intelligence Service, and that all adults in your household are not posing any risk to the related risk-evaluation. This entails among other issues:

That you have as a minimum stayed within NATO/EU/MISWG countries for the last 7 years only interrupted by short stays abroad, and
That you have not committed serious criminal offences




Terma group has headquarters in Denmark and is a high-tech company developing products and systems for defense and non-defense security applications, including command and control systems, radar systems, self-protection systems for aircraft, space technology, and aerostructures for the aircraft industry. TERMA | Allies in innovation

Title: Next-Generation 6G & AI Research Intern
Place: Roskilde, Region Zealand, Denmark
Description:
NVIDIA is searching for talented interns at the bachelor, master, or PhD level to join our growing 6G and Agentic AI research team. The ideal candidates will be conducting innovative research at the intersection of 6G Communications, Aerial Networks, AI-RAN (AI-powered Radio Access Networks), and Agentic AI systems, working alongside top authorities in these fields.

With incredible resources at your disposal, you will be able to impact, contribute and advance these exciting domains. Topics include but are not limited to distributed AI inference at the edge, intelligent spectrum management, autonomous network optimization, AI-driven resource allocation, network virtualization, edge computing acceleration, and intelligent radio access architectures. With its unique open culture, NVIDIA is one of the best industry labs to conduct cutting-edge research in next-generation wireless and autonomous systems.

DPU Data-Processing Units are the smallest form of a data center, and provide the foundation to implement accelerated computing at the network edge, where both processing and communications experience a performance boost through the utilization of dedicated processors. DPUs enable real-time AI inference for 6G applications, support autonomous decision-making in aerial networks, and accelerate AI-RAN processing on-board, deep packet inspection and cryptography accelerations among others thanks to onboard GPUs and acceleration engines. Join us to research next-generation 6G network architectures powered by Agentic AI and aerial computing capabilities during your internship with NVIDIA.

What You'll Be Doing


Be at the forefront of 6G and Agentic AI network research
Partner and collaborate with forward-thinking industry leaders and external researchers in wireless communications
Participate and speak at conferences and events
Publish original research in next-generation networking and AI
Work with intelligent aerial and ground-based systems powered by autonomous AI agents that can learn, reason, and make independent decisions across distributed network components
Develop algorithms for autonomous network optimization and intelligent resource management


What We Need To See


Currently pursuing or completed a degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Math, Physics, Statistics, or a related field (bachelor, master, or PhD level)
General computer science and/or telecommunications background, preferably in algorithm design, system programming, wireless communications, machine learning, operating systems, and distributed systems architecture
Strong programming (C/C++/Python) and software development skills
Track record of technical excellence through coursework, projects, publications, or public repositories
Good communication skills
Interest in AI, autonomous systems, or next-generation wireless technologies is a plus


NVIDIA is widely considered to be one of the technology world's most desirable employers. We have some of the most forward-thinking and hardworking people in the world working for us. Are you creative and autonomous? Do you love the challenge of building intelligent systems that can learn and adapt in real-time? If so, we want to hear from you. Come, join our 6G and Agentic AI Research Team and help build the next-generation wireless platform driving our success in this exciting and quickly growing field.

Videreudvikling af vores interne v√¶rkt√∏jer, prim√¶rt kodet i R

Diversitet, inklusion og ligestilling

I Jyske Bank mener vi, at diversitet skaber bedre beslutninger og relationer samt et mere dynamisk arbejdsmilj√∏. Vi arbejder aktivt for inklusion og lige muligheder og opfordrer alle kvalificerede kandidater til at s√∏ge.

Brdr. A & O Johansen A/S:

Brdr. A&O Johansen A/S er en af Danmarks st√∏rste h√•ndv√¶rkergrossister. Se venligst Brdr A&O Johansen A/S
Der bliver l√∏bende investeret i digitalisering og effektivisering af forretningsprocesserne i virksomheden, hvor IT prioriteres meget h√∏jt.
Virksomheden oms√¶tter for 6 mia.kr, og har over 1100 medarbejdere, heraf 35 p√• √Örhus kontoret.
Meget √•bent og uformelt arbejdsklima, stor vidensdeling, god korps√•nd og engageret stemning.
3-dobbelt vinder af Bedste B2B-virksomhed samt
3-dobbelt vinder af Bedste Omnichannel virksomhed ved uddelingen af E-Handelsprisen.




Du tilbydes:

En attraktiv l√∏npakke efter kvalifikationer.

Dine opgaver er:

Deltage i at bygge & drifte dataplatform.
Dataplatform baseret p√• streaming & lakehouse-teknologi.
Ansvar for udvikling og drift af Kafka-baserede data pipelines.

Performanceoptimering og fejls√∏gning i produktionsmilj√∏er.

Din n√¶rmeste chef:

Venlig, √•ben, dialogorienteret og kompetent.




IT afdelingen:

Veldrevet & Professionel IT Afdeling.
IT afdelingen best√•r af 55 medarbejdere.
Meget uformelt, dialogorienteret, √•bent og dynamisk milj√∏.

Dine erhvervskvalifikationer:

Erfaring med Data pipelines i produktion ‚Äì ikke kun proof of concepts.

Title: Healthcare Data Analyst (Remote)
Place: Denmark
Description:
Role: Healthcare Data Analyst (MD, DO, MBBS, or equivalent) - Remote




Locations: Denmark (100% Remote)




Compensation: Up to USD 120/hour




We are looking for a "Healthcare Data Analyst" with clinical imaging experience contribute to advanced AI model training by creating diagnostic questions, reviewing AI outputs, and providing structured feedback. This flexible remote work enhances AI accuracy in medical imaging interpretation while fitting alongside clinical practice.




Key Responsibilities

Create and validate clinical radiology-based questions with structured reasoning
Evaluate AI-generated radiology reports for diagnostic accuracy and clinical logic
Provide detailed feedback to enhance AI model performance and reliability
Review and interpret diagnostic imaging (CT, MRI, X-ray, Ultrasound) cases for AI training




Essential Qualifications

Radiology experience and clinical experience
Current practising radiologists, fellows, or recent residents welcome
Strong clinical reasoning, attention to detail, and written English proficiency




Project Benefits

Fully remote with flexible scheduling (5-40 hrs/week)
High hourly compensation with weekly international payments
Exposure to cutting-edge AI medical imaging development
No clinical liability, patient interaction, or emergency coverage required




Equal Opportunity

All qualified applicants are welcome regardless of protected characteristics. Selection based solely on radiology expertise, clinical experience, and project requirements per applicable laws.




Apply Now!

Title: Data Analyst - Assets
Place: Aalborg, North Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to help bring more renewable energy safely to market ‚Äì every hour, every day?




At Norlys Energy Trading, we optimize portfolios of wind and solar assets across Europe and work closely across the entire value chain - from forecasting to trading. Our teams combine data-driven solutions and domain expertise, building models and insights together with analysts, quants, and even a dedicated meteorologist to turn data into real market impact.







Your role

You‚Äôll be responsible for monitoring the actual production of our wind and solar assets against short-term forecasts, identifying deviations in real time and finding the reason behind the deviation. You‚Äôll analyze root causes, implement analytical models and collaborate with trading, dispatch, and asset management to close the gap between expected and actual production.




Key responsibilities

Monitor live production vs. forecast for wind and solar across sites and portfolios.
Identify and quantify deviations and perform root-cause analysis (SCADA signal quality, availability, curtailment, grid, icing, etc.).
Deliver actionable insights for trading and dispatch (adjusted expectations, alerts, cut-in/out, maintenance windows, etc.).
Improve data quality: validation, outlier detection, and governance of high-frequency time series.
Collaborate with quants and the meteorologist on model enhancement and nowcasting (feature engineering, ramp-rate analysis, ensemble blending, A/B testing).
Define and maintain KPIs, standards, and runbooks for asset performance.
Conduct ad hoc deep dives and post-mortems on major events (storms, inverter faults, downtime).




‚ÄúEvery percentage point we improve in forecast accuracy makes renewable energy more reliable - and that‚Äôs how we move the green transition from ambition to reality.‚Äù

- Anders Borup, Head of PtX Solutions




Your profile

3‚Äì6+ years of experience in energy markets, renewables, TSO/DSO, or similar analytical/forecasting roles.
Strong Python and SQL skills; experience with Looker, or Plotly is a plus.
Familiar with SCADA/telemetry, time series, and data pipelines (APIs, message queues, data lakes).
Solid understanding of short-term forecasting (NWP models, ensembles, nowcasting) and common error patterns in wind/solar predictions.
Clear communicator able to bridge analysis, trading, and management ‚Äì in English.
Thrives in a high-paced, collaborative environment where trading, analytics, and tech work side by side.




What we offer

A dynamic work environment in Aalborg‚Äôs growing energy-tech hub ‚Äì helping build the ‚ÄúSilicon Valley of energy trading‚Äù in the north.
Close collaboration with talented colleagues across trading, quants, software, and meteorology ‚Äì and the chance to see your analysis drive real decisions in the market.
Freedom to shape tools, processes, and models in a rapidly growing company driving the green transition.




Tech stack (examples)

Python, SQL, dbt/ETL, Timescale/Influx/BigQuery, Airflow, Git, Looker, Grafana, REST/GraphQL, event streams (Kafka / PubSub).




Submit your CV and application through our careers page. Even if you don‚Äôt tick every box, we‚Äôd still love to hear from you.

  • Conduct ad hoc deep dives and post-mortems on major events (storms, inverter faults, downtime).


‚ÄúEvery percentage point we improve in forecast accuracy makes renewable energy more reliable - and that‚Äôs how we move the green transition from ambition to reality.‚Äù

- Anders Borup, Head of PtX Solutions


Your profile

  • 3‚Äì6+ years of experience in energy markets, renewables, TSO/DSO, or similar analytical/forecasting roles.
  • Strong Python and SQL skills; experience with Looker, or Plotly is a plus.
  • Familiar with SCADA/telemetry, time series, and data pipelines (APIs, message queues, data lakes).
  • Solid understanding of short-term forecasting (NWP models, ensembles, nowcasting) and common error patterns in wind/solar predictions.
  • Clear communicator able to bridge analysis, trading, and management ‚Äì in English.
  • Thrives in a high-paced, collaborative environment where trading, analytics, and tech work side by side.


What we offer

  • A dynamic work environment in Aalborg‚Äôs growing energy-tech hub ‚Äì helping build the ‚ÄúSilicon Valley of energy trading‚Äù in the north.
  • Close collaboration with talented colleagues across trading, quants, software, and meteorology ‚Äì and the chance to see your analysis drive real decisions in the market.
  • Freedom to shape tools, processes, and models in a rapidly growing company driving the green transition.


Tech stack (examples)

Python, SQL, dbt/ETL, Timescale/Influx/BigQuery, Airflow, Git, Looker, Grafana, REST/GraphQL, event streams (Kafka / PubSub).

Title: Senior Marketing Data Analyst
Place: Denmark
Description:
The AI orchestration of your wildest imagination.

n8n is the open workflow orchestration platform built for the new era of AI. We give technical teams the freedom of code with the speed of no-code, so they can automate faster, smarter, and without limits. Backed by a fiercely inventive community and 500+ builder-approved integrations, we‚Äôre changing the way people bring systems together and scale ideas for impact.

Since our founding in 2019, we‚Äôve grown into a diverse team of over 160 - working across Europe and the US, connected by a shared builder spirit and with our centre of gravity in Berlin. Along the way, we‚Äôve:


Cultivated a community of more than 650,000 active developers and builders
Earned 145k+ GitHub stars, making us one of the world‚Äôs Top 40 most popular projects
Been ranked as one of Europe‚Äôs most promising privately held SaaS startups (4th in Sifted‚Äôs 2025 B2B SaaS Rising 100)
Raised $240m to date, from Sequoia‚Äôs first German seed to our recent $180m Series C - bringing us to a $2.5bn valuation
And are grateful for our 94 eNPS score (most companies would call 70 excellent)


That‚Äôs the company we‚Äôve built. Now we‚Äôd love to see what you can build. If you‚Äôre applying, try n8n out - whether you‚Äôre technical or not - and share a screenshot of your first workflow with us. The easiest place to start is here: app.n8n.cloud/register.

We‚Äôre in a defining moment of an incredible journey. Come and build with us.

üéØ Your main goal will be to bring rigor, insight, and actionability to n8n‚Äôs marketing data, helping us understand what works, identify funnel gaps, and guide data-driven decisions that scale our growth.

To do so, you‚Äôll take ownership of building trusted analytics foundations, actionable insights, and clear reporting that empower our marketing leaders to make smarter investment decisions.

BUILD ROBUST MARKETING ANALYTICS FOUNDATIONS


Design, implement, and maintain end-to-end tracking and measurement for paid and organic campaigns.
Ensure accurate tagging, integrations, and data flows across platforms like YouTube, social, and website analytics.
Anticipate and solve data quality and measurement challenges before they impact insights.


TURN DATA INTO INSIGHTS THAT DRIVE STRATEGY


Analyze top-of-funnel performance across channels to uncover gaps and opportunities.
Deliver actionable recommendations that shape budget allocation and campaign strategy.
Support Monthly Business Reviews with data-backed insights that influence leadership decisions.


ENABLE SCALABLE REPORTING AND DASHBOARDS


Build and maintain dashboards that make marketing performance easy to track and understand.
Partner with the Data and Website teams to ensure clean, consistent data pipelines.
Standardize metrics definitions and measurement frameworks across marketing functions.


Requirements

Must-haves


üìä Marketing analytics expertise: You have 5+ years of experience in marketing analytics or campaign measurement in a B2B SaaS context, ideally PLG or developer-focused.
üß† Technical skills: You‚Äôre fluent in SQL and comfortable working with tools like dbt and BigQuery to build scalable data models.
‚öôÔ∏è Tracking and automation: You know your way around marketing automation, tag management, and reporting tools, and can set up accurate, GDPR-compliant tracking.
üîç Analytical mindset: You‚Äôre proactive in identifying data issues, solving measurement challenges, and translating data into actionable insights.


Nice-to-haves


üì∫ YouTube and brand campaign analytics: You have experience measuring the impact of YouTube ads and social or brand initiatives.
üß© Data privacy experience: You‚Äôre familiar with GDPR-compliant measurement setups and privacy-first tracking practices.


Why join us?

At n8n, your insights won‚Äôt just live in dashboards; they‚Äôll directly shape how we grow. You‚Äôll build the marketing analytics foundation from the ground up, partner closely with marketing leadership, and influence how we invest across channels. You‚Äôll join a fast-growing, remote-first B2B SaaS company with a collaborative culture and a 94 eNPS score, working alongside teams who value autonomy, experimentation, and continuous learning.

Sound like a challenge you‚Äôre excited to take on?

Apply now and help us scale the future of automation, powered by data.

n8n is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

We can sponsor visas to Germany; for any other country, you need to have existing right to work.

Our company language is English.

You care about diversity and inclusion? We do too! Check out our Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging initiatives at n8n (https://www.notion.so/n8n/Diversity-inclusion-and-belonging-n8n-c1bec2fff536422d868b1a438d990e35).

Location disclaimer: If you see multiple job postings for the same role, it is most likely because we're hiring remotely for this role and posting in different locations to make sure every potential candidate can see the role. Please apply to the location you're the most likely to work from in the future.

Benefits


Competitive compensation üí∏ ‚Äì We offer fair and attractive pay.
Ownership üí™ ‚Äì Our core value is to ‚Äúempower others,‚Äù and we mean it‚Äîyou‚Äôll get a slice of n8n with equity.
Work/life balance üèñÔ∏è ‚Äì We work hard but ensure you have time to recharge:
Europe: 30 days of vacation, plus public holidays wherever you are.
US: 15 vacation days, 8 sick days, plus public holidays wherever you are.
Health & wellness ü©∫ ‚Äì
Europe: We provide benefits according to local country norms.*
US: Multiple low-premium, low-deductible medical plans with coverage for individuals and families‚Äîplus a no-cost premium HDHP option with a pre-seeded HSA‚Äîalong with dental and vision coverage.
Future planning üí∞ ‚Äì
Europe: We provide pension contributions according to local country norms.*
US: 401(k) retirement plan with a 4% employer match.
Financial security üõ°Ô∏è ‚Äì
Europe: We provide benefits according to local country norms.*
US: Company-paid short-term and long-term disability insurance, plus life insurance to support you and your loved ones.
Career growth üìà ‚Äì We hire rising stars who grow with us! You‚Äôll get ‚Ç¨1K (or equivalent) per year to spend on courses, books, events, or coaching to level up your skills.
A passionate team ü§© ‚Äì We love our product, and we prove it with regular hackathons where we see who can build the coolest thing with it!
Remote-first üåè ‚Äì Our team works remotely across Europe, with regular off-sites for team bonding. Some roles, like sales in the US, are hybrid‚Äîplease check the job description.
Giving back ü§ù ‚Äì We're big fans of open source, and you'll get $100 per month to support projects you care about.
AI enablement ü§ñ ‚Äì We believe in working smarter‚Äîeveryone gets an unlimited AI budget to explore and use the best tools to boost productivity and creativity.
Transparency üôè ‚Äì We all know what everyone‚Äôs working on, how the company is doing‚Äîthe whole shebang.
An ambitious but kind culture üòç ‚Äì People love working here‚Äîour eNPS for 2024 is 94!

Title: Business Intelligence Specialist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Er du passioneret omkring at skabe v√¶rdi med data, og har du lyst til at bidrage til en transformation i vores BI-team? Vil du v√¶re med til at formulere og drive vores datawarehouse-strategi i f√¶llesskab med et st√¶rkt team og sikre, at vi kan tage databaserede beslutninger p√• tv√¶rs af organisationen?




Hej, jeg er leder for afdelingen for Data & Insights, og vi arbejder med data for at skabe indsigt og drive strategiske beslutninger p√• tv√¶rs af vores virksomhed. Vi er i en sp√¶ndende transformationsfase og s√∏ger en medarbejder, der sammen med resten af vores team vil tage ansvar for at definere og kommunikere tekniske krav for vores nye datawarehouse og sikre, at vi kan levere p√• vores globale strategi s√•vel som p√• de enkelte afdelingers behov.

Vi s√∏ger en ny kollega, der kan tage del i ejerskabet over vores datawarehouse-projekt og drive udviklingen af vores BI-strategi sammen med teamet. Du vil arbejde sammen med et team best√•ende af BI Specialists, BI Developers, Web Analytics Specialists, Insights Specialists og AI Specialists. M√•let er at skabe et team, der er fuldt fokuseret p√• at levere v√¶rdifuld indsigt og strategisk r√•dgivning ved hj√¶lp af data.




Opgaver og ansvarsomr√•der

Som Business Intelligence Specialist hos os vil du arbejde i sp√¶ndingsfeltet mellem data og forretning. Dine opgaver vil prim√¶rt v√¶re:

Definere og kommunikere tekniske krav til udvikling og vedligeholdelse af vores nye datawarehouse i Microsoft SQL Server, i samarbejde med teamet
Sikre dataeksponering til slutbrugere via QlikView og QlikSense
Forst√•else og implementering af global strategi samt afdelingsspecifikke strategier
Udarbejdelse af KPI-rapporter og dashboards til forskellige forretningsenheder
Bidrage til data governance og kvalitetssikring af vores data
Samarbejde med kolleger p√• tv√¶rs af afdelinger for at identificere og l√∏se datarelaterede udfordringer




Skal du v√¶re en del af teamet?

Vi s√∏ger en ny kollega med st√¶rk erfaring inden for Business Intelligence, som √∏nsker at v√¶re med til at drive vores datawarehouse-projekt og skabe v√¶rdi gennem data. Jobbet kr√¶ver gode kompetencer inden for SQL og data modellering samt en st√¶rk interesse for at forst√• og st√∏tte forretningsstrategier. Teknisk erfaring er et plus, men det vigtigste er evnen til at formulere og specificere tekniske krav for implementering af andre BI-specialister. Vores datawarehouse-udvikling er en teamopgave, og vi s√∏ger derfor en kollega, der trives med samarbejde og f√¶lles ansvar. Vi √∏nsker hele tiden at forbedre os og s√∏ger derfor ogs√• en kollega, som gerne vil udvikle sig og tage del i interne sparringssessioner.




Vi s√∏ger en BI Specialist med f√∏lgende egenskaber:

Erfaring med forskellige SQL-dialekter (MySQL, PostgreSQL, SQL Server, Snowflake SQL)
Kendskab til og erfaring med dbt er en fordel
Kendskab til QlikView og QlikSense er en fordel
St√¶rk forst√•else af dimensionel modellering
Erfaring med data warehouse-udvikling
Gode kommunikationsevner og interesse for at formidle analyser og indsigter
Evne til at arbejde i en organisation med et st√¶rkt kommercielt fokus
Interesse for at forst√• b√•de den overordnede strategi og de specifikke udfordringer i de forskellige afdelinger




Mig som leder

Jeg har en forventning om, at du vil g√∏re dit allerbedste ud fra din faglighed, og at du er bevidst om, at vi l√∏fter i flok. Jeg vil altid v√¶re tilg√¶ngelig som sparringspartner, men i dagligdagen er det dit ansvar at sikre, at dine kolleger f√•r maksimalt udbytte af de data og indsigter, du leverer. Jeg gl√¶der mig til at f√• en mere med p√• holdet. Vi holder samtaler l√∏bende, s√• send din ans√∏gning snarest muligt.




De bedste hilsner,

Henri Legentil-Borup,

Head of Data & Insights

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Aarhus, Central Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
Use your excellent data and teamwork skills to¬†help us¬†expand our modern¬†data platform.¬†¬†




Who we are¬†

Lind Capital is a proprietary trading company focused on the financial markets. We combine market¬†expertise,¬†cutting-edge¬†technology, data-driven decisions, and quantitative models to execute the best possible trades.¬†¬†




We bring together talented people from diverse backgrounds in an informal work environment focused on creating results together. We empower our team to make decisions and prefer direct collaboration over bureaucracy.¬†




Our¬†diverse¬†team of 25+¬†are based in Aarhus, Denmark.¬†




The role¬†

Data is central to Lind Capital‚Äôs success and key to our future growth, and we are looking to expand our¬†data team that currently consists of¬†six Data Engineers and ML Engineers.¬†¬†




We run a modern data stack centered on Python (incl. Polars), Airflow,¬†Parquet¬†and Apache Iceberg, with Athena, Postgres,¬†Kafka, and more in the mix. In this role,¬†you‚Äôll¬†turn structured and unstructured data into trusted, well-modeled datasets that power production applications, analytics, and reporting ‚Äî while helping us expand reliability, performance, and capabilities across¬†our data¬†lakehouse.¬†




You‚Äôll¬†work in a cross-functional squad alongside Data Engineers, Software Engineers, Quantitative Traders, and Risk professionals, building data products that directly support investment decisions and risk management.¬†




Key responsibilities¬†

Collaborate closely with analysts,¬†software¬†and ML engineers to define data needs and translate them into durable datasets and interfaces.¬†
Design, build, and¬†operate¬†batch and¬†streaming¬†pipelines in our cloud-based data¬†lakehouse.¬†
Build and¬†maintain¬†cloud¬†infrastructure using infrastructure-as-code.¬†
Enable both batch and live¬†serving of¬†data for applications, analytics, ML models and reporting ‚Äî with an eye on correctness, latency, and cost.¬†
Implement data quality checks and improve pipeline observability (monitoring, alerting, and fast debugging when things break).¬†
Contribute to our data strategy and promote strong engineering practices (version control, automated testing, CI/CD,¬†code reviews).¬†




What we offer¬†

The opportunity to contribute to our data journey.¬†
A culture grounded in quantitative thinking, curiosity, and experimentation.¬†
Ownership and accountability for data pipelines¬†and cross-functional squad outcomes.¬†
A dynamic environment that balances¬†a¬†disciplined¬†approach to data¬†pipelines with¬†the freedom to innovate.¬†
An inclusive, caring, and psychologically safe workplace where diverse perspectives, ideas, and approaches lead to high performance.¬†




What we are looking for¬†

Several years of work experience with¬†Data or Software Engineering.¬†
Strong Python engineering skills (e.g.¬†clean code, tests, packaging).¬†
Experience with Orchestration frameworks (e.g., Apache¬†Airflow).¬†
Solid SQL skills and familiarity with data stores for both transactional and analytical workloads.¬†
Cloud familiarity (e.g.¬†AWS), plus comfort with CI/CD, Git, and infrastructure-as-code tooling.¬†
Curiosity on¬†new technologies¬†such as AI.¬†
Team¬†player¬†with high empathy and¬†good communication¬†skills who can collaborate and thrive in a cross-functional team with diverse backgrounds and skills.¬†

Ôªø

We value potential over perfect¬†match, and we encourage you to apply‚ÄØeven if you¬†don't¬†meet all the above.¬†On the contrary, we do not expect you to be the unicorn that fits all criteria 100%.¬†




Location¬†

We support flexible working arrangements; however, success in this role depends on close collaboration, which works best when colleagues are physically together. You should therefore expect to work from our Aarhus office 4‚Äì5 days per week. Our working language is English, and we welcome applications from non-Danish speakers.¬†




Benefits¬†

Professional development and clear career growth opportunities.¬†
Competitive compensation and employee shares.¬†
Good maternity/paternity terms.¬†
Modern office environment with a healthy canteen and snacks.¬†
Visa support (if needed).




The¬†practical stuff¬†

Start date: As soon as possible.¬†




To apply, please¬†submit¬†your CV, grade transcript, cover letter, and other relevant documents via the link below.¬†




Applications will be processed on a rolling basis.¬†

HTML:
Use your excellent data and teamwork skills to help us expand our modern data platform.  


Who we are 

Lind Capital is a proprietary trading company focused on the financial markets. We combine market expertise, cutting-edge technology, data-driven decisions, and quantitative models to execute the best possible trades.  


We bring together talented people from diverse backgrounds in an informal work environment focused on creating results together. We empower our team to make decisions and prefer direct collaboration over bureaucracy. 


Our diverse team of 25+ are based in Aarhus, Denmark. 


The role 

Data is central to Lind Capital‚Äôs success and key to our future growth, and we are looking to expand our data team that currently consists of six Data Engineers and ML Engineers.  


We run a modern data stack centered on Python (incl. Polars), Airflow, Parquet and Apache Iceberg, with Athena, Postgres, Kafka, and more in the mix. In this role, you‚Äôll turn structured and unstructured data into trusted, well-modeled datasets that power production applications, analytics, and reporting ‚Äî while helping us expand reliability, performance, and capabilities across our data lakehouse. 


You‚Äôll work in a cross-functional squad alongside Data Engineers, Software Engineers, Quantitative Traders, and Risk professionals, building data products that directly support investment decisions and risk management. 


Key responsibilities 

  • Collaborate closely with analysts, software and ML engineers to define data needs and translate them into durable datasets and interfaces. 
  • Design, build, and operate batch and streaming pipelines in our cloud-based data lakehouse. 
  • Build and maintain cloud infrastructure using infrastructure-as-code. 
  • Enable both batch and live serving of data for applications, analytics, ML models and reporting ‚Äî with an eye on correctness, latency, and cost. 
  • Implement data quality checks and improve pipeline observability (monitoring, alerting, and fast debugging when things break). 
  • Contribute to our data strategy and promote strong engineering practices (version control, automated testing, CI/CD, code reviews). 


What we offer 

  • The opportunity to contribute to our data journey. 
  • A culture grounded in quantitative thinking, curiosity, and experimentation. 
  • Ownership and accountability for data pipelines and cross-functional squad outcomes. 
  • A dynamic environment that balances a disciplined approach to data pipelines with the freedom to innovate. 
  • An inclusive, caring, and psychologically safe workplace where diverse perspectives, ideas, and approaches lead to high performance. 


What we are looking for 

  • Several years of work experience with Data or Software Engineering. 
  • Strong Python engineering skills (e.g. clean code, tests, packaging). 
  • Experience with Orchestration frameworks (e.g., Apache Airflow). 
  • Solid SQL skills and familiarity with data stores for both transactional and analytical workloads. 
  • Cloud familiarity (e.g. AWS), plus comfort with CI/CD, Git, and infrastructure-as-code tooling. 
  • Curiosity on new technologies such as AI. 
  • Team player with high empathy and good communication skills who can collaborate and thrive in a cross-functional team with diverse backgrounds and skills. 

Ôªø

We value potential over perfect match, and we encourage you to apply‚ÄØeven if you don't meet all the above. On the contrary, we do not expect you to be the unicorn that fits all criteria 100%. 


Location 

We support flexible working arrangements; however, success in this role depends on close collaboration, which works best when colleagues are physically together. You should therefore expect to work from our Aarhus office 4‚Äì5 days per week. Our working language is English, and we welcome applications from non-Danish speakers. 


Benefits 

  • Professional development and clear career growth opportunities. 
  • Competitive compensation and employee shares. 
  • Good maternity/paternity terms. 
  • Modern office environment with a healthy canteen and snacks. 
  • Visa support (if needed).


The practical stuff 

Start date: As soon as possible. 


To apply, please submit your CV, grade transcript, cover letter, and other relevant documents via the link below. 


Applications will be processed on a rolling basis.

Title: Business Intelligence Lead
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Lead BI Consultant ‚Äì Client & Delivery

Vil du kombinere BI-udvikling med ansvar for leverancer ‚Äì og bygge st√¶rke datal√∏sninger p√• moderne platforme?

Hos Initiate hj√¶lper vi vores kunder med at skabe forretningsv√¶rdi med data. Vi s√∏ger nu en Lead BI Consultant, der kan drive BI-leverancer stabilt og professionelt, og v√¶re bindeled mellem kundeansvarlig og leveranceteam.

Du f√•r en central rolle med tydeligt mandat, hvor du b√•de arbejder t√¶t p√• BI-l√∏sningen og sikrer struktur, fremdrift og kvalitet p√• udvalgte kunder.




Om rollen

Som Lead BI Consultant ‚Äì Client & Delivery har du ansvar for at sikre stabil, struktureret og v√¶rdiskabende leverance p√• BI-kunder. Du tager det daglige ansvar for fremdrift, koordinering og kvalitet, og sikrer, at b√•de kunde og team oplever overblik og retning.

Du arbejder t√¶t p√• kundens forretning og data og bidrager til at oms√¶tte behov til BI-l√∏sninger med st√¶rk datamodellering og en arkitektur, der kan holde i drift.

Samtidig spiller du en aktiv rolle i at spotte nye behov og muligheder hos kunden, s√• samarbejdet kan udvikles l√∏bende i t√¶t samarbejde med kundeansvarlig.




Dine vigtigste opgaver

Du kommer typisk til at arbejde med:

Projekt- og leveranceansvar p√• kunder fra aftale til f√¶rdig leverance
Planl√¶gning og koordinering af leverancer, milep√¶le og ressourcer (uden personaleansvar)
BI-udvikling og implementering, hvor du sikrer at l√∏sningen er solid, skalerbar og skaber v√¶rdi
Datamodellering og l√∏sningsarkitektur, s√• der er sammenh√¶ng mellem datagrundlag, model og rapportering
Kundedialog om fremdrift, prioritering og n√¶ste skridt
H√•ndtering af √¶ndringer i scope, prioritering og forventningsafstemning
Identifikation af nye behov og muligheder (f.eks. udvidelser, optimering eller nye BI-initiativer), som bringes videre til kundeansvarlig




Tidsfordeling (vejledende)

Ca. 50 % BI-udvikling og implementering og ca. 50 % projekt-, leverance- og kundedialog.




Hvem er du?

Vi forestiller os, at du har meget erfaring med BI-l√∏sninger og dataplatforme, og at du trives i en rolle med b√•de ansvar, teknik og kundekontakt. Du arbejder struktureret, tager naturligt ejerskab og kan skabe fremdrift i komplekse BI-projekter.

Rollen kombinerer teknisk BI-forst√•else med ansvar for fremdrift og k

oordinering. Du arbejder t√¶t p√• l√∏sningen og sikrer, at leverancen kommer i m√•l med h√∏j kvalitet med fokus p√• b√•de struktur, prioritering og samarbejde p√• tv√¶rs af kunde og team.




Du har f.eks. erfaring med:

Microsoft BI-stacken (f.eks. Power BI, SQL og Azure)
Datamodellering og l√∏sningsarkitektur (f.eks. star schema, semantiske modeller og principper for v√¶rdifuld rapportering)
Dataflow fra kilder til rapportering, hvor datagrundlag, transformationer og rapportlag h√¶nger sammen i en stabil leverance
Moderne dataplatforme som f.eks. Databricks og/eller Fabric (og forst√•else for lakehouse/warehouse-tilgange)
Team- og leveranceledelse uden personaleansvar (planl√¶gning, prioritering og opf√∏lgning p√• opgaver og milep√¶le)
Kunde- og interessenth√•ndtering (forventningsafstemning, l√∏bende status, prioritering og dialog p√• tv√¶rs af kundens forretning og IT)
Salg og planl√¶gning af arbejdsspor (opf√∏lgning og sikring af fremtidige projekter, herunder grooming og integration med forretningens √∏vrige strategier og ambitioner)




Hvad tilbyder vi?

Hos Initiate f√•r du:

En central rolle med reelt ansvar og tydeligt mandat
T√¶t samarbejde med kundeansvarlige og ledelsen
Mulighed for at pr√¶ge, hvordan vi driver BI-projekter og kundeforhold fremadrettet
En organisation med h√∏j faglighed, korte beslutningsveje og stor tillid
Godt kollegaskab med socialt f√¶llesskab og videndeling




S√∏g stillingen

Du s√∏ger ved at sende dit CV og gerne en kort ans√∏gning til Frederik Hye-Hestvang, fhh@initiate.dk, hvor du beskriver din motivation og eksempler p√•, hvordan du arbejder med teknik og leverance i praksis.




Opstart er snarest muligt.




Vi indkalder til samtaler l√∏bende, s√• t√∏v ikke med at sende din ans√∏gning.

Title: Senior Data (ADF) Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Location: Denmark, Copenhagen, or Aarhus (hybrid)

Schedule: 1 FTE (40 hours/week)

6-month contract with a high possibility of extension.

We are Baltic Assist, an outsourcing company specializing in innovative remote career solutions. We provide exciting opportunities on a global level, fostering long-term cooperation between top talent and our partners. By cultivating a desirable environment, our people are empowered to excel and engage with a community of diverse professionals. With a commitment to efficiency and innovation, Baltic Assist aims to be the go-to choice for seeking rewarding careers.

What You'll Be Doing

We are looking for a skilled Data Engineer with proven experience in Azure Data Factory (ADF) to join our dynamic team at one of the country's biggest players in finance.

How You'll Spend Your Day


Create, maintain, and troubleshoot Azure Data Factory (ADF) pipelines to support business data flows and operational processes.
Ensure all pipelines are optimized for performance, scalability, and long‚Äëterm reliability.
Collaborate closely with business and technical stakeholders to understand requirements and translate them into efficient, scalable data solutions.
Monitor pipeline performance proactively and implement improvements to enhance stability and throughput.
Provide technical guidance and support to ensure seamless day‚Äëto‚Äëday operation of ADF pipelines.
Design, implement, and optimize data models that meet business needs and enable efficient storage, retrieval, and analysis.
Work with CRM Dataverse to understand, manage, and evolve its data model, ensuring smooth integration with connected systems and data processes.


You'll be successful if you have


At least 8 years of hands‚Äëon experience working with Azure Data Factory (ADF), including designing, creating, and managing complex, large‚Äëscale data pipelines.
Deep expertise in Microsoft SQL, with strong experience using Azure SQL Database, building and maintaining stored procedures, managing database access, roles, and permissions, and designing robust data structures.
Extensive background in performance optimisation across SQL databases, data models, and data workflows.
Strong understanding of the CRM Dataverse data model, including its structure, behaviour, and integration patterns.
Advanced proficiency in data modelling, with the ability to design, optimise, and maintain scalable models aligned with business requirements.
Proven ability to troubleshoot and resolve complex issues across data pipelines, databases, and end‚Äëto‚Äëend data architectures.
Familiarity with cloud‚Äëbased data solutions and integration services within the Azure ecosystem.
Excellent communication and stakeholder‚Äëmanagement skills, with experience collaborating across technical, business, and cross‚Äëfunctional teams.
Strong organisational skills, with the ability to work independently, manage multiple priorities, and deliver high‚Äëquality solutions in a fast‚Äëpaced environment.


What We Offer


Flexible working arrangements and a hybrid work model to help you succeed in your career while balancing personal needs.
An inspiring environment in a large IT organisation.
Work in an international team, which concentrates on innovative business-facing solutions.
An extensive training program to ensure that your skills are maintained and updated on an ongoing basis.
Open and friendly company culture, great colleagues, company events & teambuildings.


At Baltic Assist, we believe that the strength of our team lies in the diversity of our backgrounds and perspectives. We are fully committed to promoting equal opportunities at every stage of our recruitment and selection processes. Recruitment at Baltic Assist is based solely on individual merit, qualifications, and professional competence. Our shortlisting, interviewing, and selection practices are conducted without discrimination on the grounds of gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital or civil partnership status, race, nationality, ethnic origin, religion or beliefs, age, veteran status, disability, medical condition, pregnancy or parental status, trade union membership, or any other protected characteristics.

By applying to this position, candidates acknowledge and consent that any information provided during the application process or available on the communication channels through which they were contacted (e.g., LinkedIn, email, or other professional platforms) may be collected, stored, and processed by Baltic Assist solely for recruitment purposes.

HTML:
Location: Denmark, Copenhagen, or Aarhus (hybrid)

Schedule: 1 FTE (40 hours/week)

6-month contract with a high possibility of extension.

We are Baltic Assist, an outsourcing company specializing in innovative remote career solutions. We provide exciting opportunities on a global level, fostering long-term cooperation between top talent and our partners. By cultivating a desirable environment, our people are empowered to excel and engage with a community of diverse professionals. With a commitment to efficiency and innovation, Baltic Assist aims to be the go-to choice for seeking rewarding careers.

What You'll Be Doing

We are looking for a skilled Data Engineer with proven experience in Azure Data Factory (ADF) to join our dynamic team at one of the country's biggest players in finance.

How You'll Spend Your Day

  • Create, maintain, and troubleshoot Azure Data Factory (ADF) pipelines to support business data flows and operational processes.
  • Ensure all pipelines are optimized for performance, scalability, and long‚Äëterm reliability.
  • Collaborate closely with business and technical stakeholders to understand requirements and translate them into efficient, scalable data solutions.
  • Monitor pipeline performance proactively and implement improvements to enhance stability and throughput.
  • Provide technical guidance and support to ensure seamless day‚Äëto‚Äëday operation of ADF pipelines.
  • Design, implement, and optimize data models that meet business needs and enable efficient storage, retrieval, and analysis.
  • Work with CRM Dataverse to understand, manage, and evolve its data model, ensuring smooth integration with connected systems and data processes.

You'll be successful if you have

  • At least 8 years of hands‚Äëon experience working with Azure Data Factory (ADF), including designing, creating, and managing complex, large‚Äëscale data pipelines.
  • Deep expertise in Microsoft SQL, with strong experience using Azure SQL Database, building and maintaining stored procedures, managing database access, roles, and permissions, and designing robust data structures.
  • Extensive background in performance optimisation across SQL databases, data models, and data workflows.
  • Strong understanding of the CRM Dataverse data model, including its structure, behaviour, and integration patterns.
  • Advanced proficiency in data modelling, with the ability to design, optimise, and maintain scalable models aligned with business requirements.
  • Proven ability to troubleshoot and resolve complex issues across data pipelines, databases, and end‚Äëto‚Äëend data architectures.
  • Familiarity with cloud‚Äëbased data solutions and integration services within the Azure ecosystem.
  • Excellent communication and stakeholder‚Äëmanagement skills, with experience collaborating across technical, business, and cross‚Äëfunctional teams.
  • Strong organisational skills, with the ability to work independently, manage multiple priorities, and deliver high‚Äëquality solutions in a fast‚Äëpaced environment.

What We Offer

  • Flexible working arrangements and a hybrid work model to help you succeed in your career while balancing personal needs.
  • An inspiring environment in a large IT organisation.
  • Work in an international team, which concentrates on innovative business-facing solutions.
  • An extensive training program to ensure that your skills are maintained and updated on an ongoing basis.
  • Open and friendly company culture, great colleagues, company events & teambuildings.

At Baltic Assist, we believe that the strength of our team lies in the diversity of our backgrounds and perspectives. We are fully committed to promoting equal opportunities at every stage of our recruitment and selection processes. Recruitment at Baltic Assist is based solely on individual merit, qualifications, and professional competence. Our shortlisting, interviewing, and selection practices are conducted without discrimination on the grounds of gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital or civil partnership status, race, nationality, ethnic origin, religion or beliefs, age, veteran status, disability, medical condition, pregnancy or parental status, trade union membership, or any other protected characteristics.

By applying to this position, candidates acknowledge and consent that any information provided during the application process or available on the communication channels through which they were contacted (e.g., LinkedIn, email, or other professional platforms) may be collected, stored, and processed by Baltic Assist solely for recruitment purposes.

Baltic Assist is committed to protecting your personal data in compliance with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR). All information collected during the recruitment process will be handled securely and used exclusively for recruitment purposes. Your data will not be shared with unauthorized parties, and it will be retained only as long as necessary for the recruitment process or as required by applicable laws. By applying, you consent to the processing of your personal data in accordance with our privacy policy and GDPR guidelines.

Title: Fraud Detection Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Trustpilot, we're on an incredible journey. We're a profitable, high-growth FTSE-250 company with a big vision: to become the universal symbol of trust. We run the world's largest independent consumer review platform, and while we've come a long way, there's still so much exciting work to do. Come join us at the heart of trust!

We‚Äôre looking for a curious and analytical Fraud Detection Analyst to join our global Fraud & Investigations team. You‚Äôll analyse data, spot patterns, and write detection rules that help stop fraud in its tracks ‚Äî playing a vital role in protecting consumers, businesses, and the integrity of our platform.

You‚Äôll work on complex, often ambiguous challenges in the ever-evolving world of online trust. If you love solving problems, diving into data, and making a real difference - this is your chance.

You‚Äôll be joining a collaborative, inquisitive team that values transparency, fairness, and a good sense of humour. As part of the wider Trust & Transparency team, we‚Äôre driving change across the business‚Äîand working to make Trustpilot the universal symbol of trust online.

What you‚Äôll be doing:

Identify fraud trends and develop a deep understanding of fraudulent behavior on our platform through the use of SQL, Google BigQuery, and Google Looker.
Formulate rules based on your analysis to mitigate fraudulent behavior across our platform.
Carry out investigations of escalated cases related to potential misuse of our platform and assist with media, legal, and customer inquiries.
Partner with our data science experts to advance our technological and procedural approaches to identifying fraudulent activity.
Work closely with our engineering teams to enhance internal tools and databases that enable us to combat fraud and scale effectively.
Act as a key resource for other departments within Trustpilot by providing analysis of customer and reviewer behavior on the platform.
Present and communicate the results of analyses and investigations to a variety of stakeholders across the department and wider company.
Work closely with and report to our Lead Fraud & Investigation Analyst.

Who you are:

Experience in data analytics or a similar analytical role‚Äîthis could be through formal education (e.g., a degree in Science, Mathematics, Computer Science) or equivalent practical experience.
Comfortable working with and interpreting large datasets.
A knack for answering difficult questions using data and the ability to translate complex findings into clear, actionable reports.
Proficiency in writing queries and preparing reports using SQL or a similar language.
Motivated by self-learning and the desire to grow your skills when faced with new challenges.
Prior knowledge of formulating rules to combat fraudulent behavior is a plus, but not a requirement.
The ability to manage multiple priorities effectively with a proactive, forward-thinking mindset

What‚Äôs in it for you:


A range of flexible working options to dedicate time to what matters to you
Competitive compensation package + bonus
25 days holiday per year, with an extra 5 days holiday allocated after your 1 year anniversary (prorated)¬†
Two (paid) volunteering days a year to spend your time giving back to the causes that matter to you and your community
Rich learning and development opportunities are supported through the Trustpilot Academy and Blinkist
Comprehensive health package, pension, and full access to Headspace, a popular mindfulness app to promote positive mental health
Paid parental leave
Central office with¬† a laid-back vibe and constant buzz of different languages being spoken everywhere you go It‚Äôs complete with a coffee bar, canteen, and table tennis and has a wide variety of refreshments available - you can opt-in for breakfast and lunch at an affordable price
Regular opportunities to connect and get to know your fellow Trusties, including company-wide celebrations and events, ERG activities, and team socials
Opportunity to join the Trustpilot Social Club for a small monthly fee and attend regular social and leisure activities like go-karting, cooking classes, and escape rooms¬†
Employee discounts to restaurants and shops¬†

Still not sure?

We want to be a part of creating a more diverse, equitable, and inclusive world of work for all. We‚Äôre excited to hear about your experiences as well as how you will contribute to our working culture. So, even if you don‚Äôt feel you don't meet all the requirements, we'd still really like to hear from you!

About us

¬†

Trustpilot began in 2007 with a simple yet powerful idea that is more relevant today than ever ‚Äî to be the universal symbol of trust, bringing consumers and businesses together through reviews. Trustpilot is open, independent, and impartial ‚Äî we help consumers make the right choices and businesses to build trust, grow and improve.

Today, we have more than 300 million reviews and 64 million monthly active users on average across the globe, with 140 billion annual Trustbox impressions, and the numbers keep growing. We have more than 1,000 employees and we‚Äôre headquartered in Copenhagen, with operations in Amsterdam, Denver, Edinburgh, Hamburg, London, Melbourne, Milan and New York.¬†

We‚Äôre driven by connection. It‚Äôs at the heart of what we do. Our culture keeps things fresh ‚Äì‚Äì it‚Äôs built on the relationships we create. We talk, we laugh, we collaborate and we respect each other. We work across borders and cultures to be the universal symbol of trust in an ever-changing world. With vibrant office locations worldwide and over 50 nationalities, we‚Äôre proud to be an equal opportunity workplace with diverse perspectives and ideas.¬†

Our purpose to help people and businesses help each other is a tall order, but we keep it real. We‚Äôre a great bunch of humans, doing awesome stuff, without fuss or pretense. A successful Trustpilot future is driven by you ‚Äì‚Äì we give you the autonomy to shape a career you can be proud of. If you‚Äôre ready to grow, let‚Äôs go.¬†

Join us at the heart of trust.

Trustpilot is committed to creating an inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive and where different viewpoints and experiences are valued and respected. Trustpilot will consider all applications for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, national origin, religious beliefs, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, neurodiversity, disability, age, parental or veteran status. Together, we are the heart of trust.

Trustpilot is a global company and our data practices are designed to ensure that your personally identifiable information is appropriately protected. Please note that your personal information will be transferred, accessed, and stored globally as necessary for the uses and disclosures stated in our Privacy Policy.

If you have a disability and would like to discuss any adjustments you might need either in submitting your application, or to the recruitment process more generally, please let us know by contacting our Talent Acquisition Team (talent.acquisition@trustpilot.com)¬†quoting the role you wish to apply for.

Any offer of employment for this position will be subject to our standard background checks.

Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Hejsa! üëã

At du har fundet vej hertil, betyder nok, at du vil vide mere om rollen som Junior Customer Success Manager. Det er vi glade for - vi mangler nemlig dig! Men f√∏rst f√•r du lige en kort intro til, hvem vi er, og hvorfor vi g√∏r det, vi g√∏r.

Resights blev skabt med en ret simpel id√©: At samle ejendomsdata √©t sted, s√• vores kunder kan spare tid og tr√¶ffe bedre beslutninger. Slut med rodede regneark og mavefornemmelser üòµ‚Äçüí´

Siden da har vi, i t√¶t samarbejde med vores kunder, udviklet platformen massivt. I dag bruges Resights til alt fra at finde investeringsejendomme og analysere markeder og transaktioner samt finde nye fremtidige projekter. F√¶llesn√¶vneren er ejendomsdata og vores mission om at g√∏re det muligt for kunderne at drive endnu mere forretning.

S√• ja, det er Resights. Men i virkeligheden er det vigtigste de 51 mennesker bag platformen - et hold af passionerede n√∏rder og teamspillere, der p√• fem √•r har bygget en hurtigt voksende scaleup med over 1.400 kunder. Og vigtigst af alt: Vi har haft det virkelig sjovt undervejs!

Om dig

Vi tror ikke p√• lange kravlister, men vi har stadig forventninger til dig! Dygtighed kan komme b√•de med erfaring og med frisk energi ‚Äì og vi v√¶rds√¶tter begge dele. N√•r det er sagt, vil dr√∏mmescenariet v√¶re, at du har 1-2 √•rs erfaring fra B2B i en kundevendt rolle, hvor du er vant til at forst√• kundebehov og skabe v√¶rdi.

Din mission

Der er √©t afg√∏rende succeskriterium i rollen: At vores kunder f√•r det fulde udbytte af Resights og forbliver abonnenter.

Hvordan g√∏r vi s√• det? Lad os s√¶tte nogle ord p√• dine opgaver som CS Specialist.

Du f√•r ansvaret for din egen portef√∏lje p√• ca. 300 kunder, som du skal sikre f√•r gl√¶de af Resights i deres daglige arbejde. Nogle kr√¶ver kun en kort onboarding, andre har brug for mere l√∏bende sparring. Derfor er din proaktivitet n√∏glen. Du skal kunne arbejde struktureret og samtidig have mange bolde i luften.

Du kan selvf√∏lgelig ikke v√¶re p√• fornavn med 300 mennesker - derfor underst√∏tter vi dig med solide v√¶rkt√∏jer og et produktteam p√• 20 specialister. De giver dig bl.a. dyb indsigt i kundernes brugsm√∏nstre via vores ‚Äúhealth score‚Äù, s√• du ved, hvor der er risiko, og hvor der ligger potentiale.

For at skabe reel kundesucces skal du v√¶re nysgerrig p√• kundernes hverdag, processer og udfordringer og hvordan du kan hj√¶lpe dem med implementering af Resights samt ops√¶tte relevante s√∏gninger. Vi arbejder med alle, der r√∏rer ved fast ejendom - fra store investorer til enkeltmandsvirksomheden, der leder efter huse til varmepumpeinstallationer. Derfor er vores CS-specialister typisk b√•de forretningsorienterede og gode til at forst√•, hvordan Resights skaber v√¶rdi p√• tv√¶rs af kundetyper og brancher.

Rollen f√•r ansvaret for en stor del af vores mindre, men vigtige kunder ‚Äì derfor skal du v√¶re skarp i aktiveringsarbejde, proaktiv support og forl√¶ngelsesdialoger.

Dine ansvarsomr√•der


Ansvar for din egen kundeportef√∏lje
Proaktiv onboarding og aktivering af nye og eksisterende brugere
Sikre tilfredshed og sparring undervejs p√• kunderejsen
Kundesupport via vores personlige supportchat (ca. 15 henvendelser om dagen)


Om Frontdesk-teamet

I Frontdesk har vi √©n f√¶lles mission: At s√¶tte kundens behov f√∏rst.

Teamet best√•r af to funktioner, der arbejder t√¶t sammen:


Nysalg: Tager kunden fra f√∏rste kontakt til underskrevet kontrakt.
Customer Success: Sikrer onboarding og l√∏bende r√•dgivning, s√• kunderne f√•r maksimal v√¶rdi af platformen.
